questions.question:
Which of the following would be the BEST overall control for an Internet business looking fbr confidentiality,
reliability and integrity of data?

justifications.A:
Transport Layer Security (TLS) is used for many ecommerce applications to set up a secure
channel for communications that provides confidentiality through a combination of public and
symmetric key encryption and integrity through hash message authentication code.
justifications.B:
An intrusion detection system (intrusion detection system (IDS)) will log network activity but is not used
fbr protecting traffic over the Internet.
justifications.C:
Public key infrastructure is used in conjunction with secure sockets layer (SSL) or for securing
communications such as ecommerce and email.
justifications.D:
A virtual private network (VPN) is a generic term for a communications tunnel that can provide
confidentiality, integrity and authentication (reliability). A VPN can operate at different levels of the
Open Systems Interconnection stack and may not always be used in conjunction with encryption. SSL can
be called a type of VPN.

questions.question: Which of the following preventive controls BEST helps secure a web application?

justifications.A: Password masking is a necessary preventive control but is not the best way to secure an application.
justifications.B:
Of the given choices, teaching developers to write secure code is the best way to secure a web
application.
justifications.C:
Encryption will protect data but is not sufficient to secure an application because other flaws in coding
can compromise the application and data. Ensuring that applications are designed in a secure way is
the best way to secure an application. This is accomplished by ensuring that developers are adequately
educated on secure coding practices.
justifications.D:
Vulnerability testing can help to ensure the security of web applications; however, the best preventive
control is developer education because building secure applications from the start is more effective.
410 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following antivirus software implementation strategies is the MOST effective in an
interconnected enterprise network?

justifications.A:
An effective antivirus solution must be a combination of server-, network- and perimeter-based scanning
and protection.
justifications.B:
An important means of controlling the spread of viruses is to deploy an enterprisewide antivirus
solution that will monitor and analyze traffic at many points. This provides a layered defense model
that is more likely to detect malware regardless of how it comes into the enterprise— through a
USB or portable storage, a network, an infected download or malicious web application.
justifications.C:
Only checking for a virus on workstations is not adequate because malware can infect many network
devices or servers as well.
justifications.D:
Because malware can enter an enterprise through many different methods, only checking for malware at
the perimeter is not enough to protect the enterprise.

questions.question:
Which of the following would be of MOST concern to an information systems (IS) auditor reviewing a
virtual private network implementation? Computers on the network are located:

justifications.A:
On an enterprise's internal network, there should be security policies and controls in place to detect and
halt an outside attack that uses an internal machine as a staging platform.
justifications.B:
Computers at the backup site are subject to the enterprise security policy and, therefore, are not high-risk
computers.
justifications.C:
One risk of a virtual private network implementation is the chance of allowing high-risk computers
onto the enterprise's network. AH machines that are allowed onto the virtual network should
be subject to the same security policy. Home computers of third-party (vendor) employees are
least subject to the enterprise security policies and, therefore, are high-risk computers. When a
computer is hacked and owned, any network that trusts that computer is at risk. Implementation
and adherence to enterprise security policy is easier when all computers on the network are on the
enterprise's campus.
justifications.D:
Computers on the network that are at the enterprise's remote offices, perhaps with different information
systems (IS) and security employees who have different ideas about security, are higher risk than
computers in the main office or backup site but have less risk than home computers.

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The PRIMARY reason for using digital signatures is to ensure data:

justifications.A: A digital signature does not address message confidentiality.
justifications.B:
Digital signatures provide integrity because the digital signature of a signed message (file, mail,
document, etc.) changes every time a single bit of the document changes; thus, a signed document
cannot be altered. A digital signature provides for message integrity, nonrepudiation and proof of
origin.
justifications.C: Availability is not related to digital signatures.
justifications.D:
In general, correctness is not related to digital signatures. A digital signature guarantee data integrity,
however, it cannot ensure correctness of signed data.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a passive cybersecurity attack?

justifications.A:
Cybersecurity threats/vulnerabilities are divided into passive and active attacks. A passive attack is
one that monitors or captures network traffic but does not in any way modify, insert or delete the
traffic. Examples of passive attacks include network analysis, eavesdropping and traffic analysis.
justifications.B: Because masquerading alters the data by modifying the origin, it is an active attack.
justifications.C:
Because a denial-of-service attack floods the network with traffic or sends malformed packets over the
network, it is an active attack.
justifications.D:
Because email spoofing alters the email header, it is an active attack.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing security incident management procedures fbr the enterprise.
Which of the following choices is the MOST important consideration?

options.A: Chain of custody of electronic evidence

justifications.A:
The preservation of evidence is the most important consideration in regard to security incident
management. If data and evidence are not collected properly, valuable information can be lost and
would not be admissible in a court of law should the enterprise decide to pursue litigation.
justifications.B:
System breach notification is an important aspect and, in many cases, may even be required by laws and
regulations; however, the security incident may not be a breach and the notification procedure might not
apply-
justifications.C:
Escalation procedures to external agencies such as the local police or special agencies dealing in
cybercrime are important. However, without proper chain of custody procedures, vital evidence may
be lost and would not be admissible in a court of law should the enterprise decide to pursue litigation.
justifications.D:
Although having procedures in place to recover lost data is important, it is critical to ensure that evidence
is protected to ensure follow-up and investigation.

questions.question: An accuracy measure fbr a biometric system is:

justifications.A:
An important consideration in the implementation of biometrics is the time required to process a user. If
the system is too slow, then it will impact productivity and lead to frustration. However, this is not an
accuracy measure.
justifications.B:
The registration time is a measure of the effort taken to enroll a user in the system. This is not an accuracy
measure.
justifications.C:
The file size to retain biometric information varies depending on the type of biometric solution selected.
This is not an accuracy measure.
justifications.D:
Three main accuracy measures are used for a biometric solution: false-rejection rate (FRR), cross­
error rate (CER) and false-acceptance rate (FAR). FRR is a measure of how often valid individuals
are rejected. FAR is a measure of how often invalid individuals are accepted. CER is a measure of
when the false-rejection rate equals the false-acceptance rate.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor evaluating logical access controls should FIRST:

options.A: document the controls applied to the potential access paths to the system.
options.B: test controls over the access paths to determine if they are functional.
options.C: evaluate the security environment in relation to written policies and practices.
options.D: obtain an understanding of the security risk to information processing.

justifications.A:
Documentation and evaluation is the second step in assessing the adequacy, efficiency and effectiveness
of the controls, and is based on the risk to the system that necessitates the controls.
justifications.B: The third step is to test the access paths—to determine if the controls are functioning.
justifications.C:
It is only after the risk is determined and the controls documented that the information systems (IS)
auditor can evaluate the security environment to assess its adequacy through review of the written
policies, observation of practices and comparison of them to appropriate security good practices.
justifications.D:
When evaluating logical access controls, an IS auditor should first obtain an understanding of the
security risk facing information processing by reviewing relevant documentation, inquiries, and
conducting a risk assessment. This is necessary so that the IS auditor can ensure that the controls
are adequate to address risk.

questions.question:
Which of the following BEST describes the goal of business process-driven enterprise architecture? It
attempts to better understand an organization in terms of:

options.B: its laws, regulations and contractual commitments.
options.C: its organizational structure, roles and responsibilities.
options.D: its core value-adding and supporting processes.

justifications.A:
An organization's strategies, policies and standards are used to better understand the core and supporting
business processes used in value creation to be able to improve or replace them.
justifications.B:
An organization's laws, regulations and contractual commitments should be understood to know how
stakeholders, value should be created and preserved.
justifications.C:
Understanding the organization's hierarchy, roles and responsibilities helps in knowing how different
actors contribute to value creation and preservation.
justifications.D:
Business process-driven enterprise architecture improves a business by understanding core business
processes, their constituent parts and the technology that supports them to progressively redesign
and replace them.
414 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The review of router access control lists should be conducted during:

justifications.A:
Environmental reviews examine physical security such as power and physical access. They do not require
a review of the router access control lists.
justifications.B:
Network security reviews include reviewing router access control lists, port scanning, internal and
external connections to the system, etc.
justifications.C:
Business continuity reviews ensure that the business continuity plan is up-to-date, adequate to protect the
organization and tested, and do not require a review of the router access control lists.
justifications.D:
Data integrity reviews validate data accuracy and protect from improper alterations, but do not require a
review of the router access control lists.

questions.question: Which of the following components is responsible for the collection of data in an intrusion detection system?

justifications.A: Analyzers receive input from sensors and determine the presence of and type of intrusive activity.
justifications.B: An administration console is the management interface component of an intrusion detection system (IDS).
justifications.C: A user interface allows the administrators to interact with the IDS.
justifications.D:
Sensors are responsible fbr collecting data. Sensors may be attached to a network, server or other
location and may gather data from many points fbr later analysis.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST significant function of an enterprise public key infrastructure and
certificate authority employing X.509 digital certificates?

options.A: It provides the public/private key set fbr the encryption and signature services used by email and file space.
options.B: It binds a digital certificate and its public key to an individual subscriber's identity.
options.C: It provides the authoritative source for employee identity and personal details.
options.D: It provides the authoritative authentication source for object access.

justifications.A:
Although some email applications depend on public key infrastructure (PKI)-issued certificates for
nonrepudiation, the purpose of PKI is to provide authentication of the individual and link an individual
with their private key. The certificate (certification) authority (CA) does not ordinarily create the user's
private key.
justifications.B:
PKI is primarily used to gain assurance that protected data or services originated from a legitimate
source. The process to ensure the validity of the subscriber identity by linking to the digital
certificate/public key is strict and rigorous.
justifications.C: Personal details are not stored in or provided by components in the PKI.
justifications.D:
Authentication services within operating systems and applications may be built on PKI-issued certificates,
but PKI does not provide authentication services fbr object access.

questions.question: A digital signature contains a message digest to:

options.A: show if the message has been altered after transmission.
options.C: confirm the identity of the originator.
options.D: enable message transmission in a digital format.

justifications.A:
The message digest is calculated and included in a digital signature to prove that the message has
not been altered. The message digest sent with the message should have the same value as the
recalculation of the digest of the received message.
justifications.B: The message digest does not define the algorithm; it is there to ensure integrity.
justifications.C: The message digest does not confirm the identity of the user; it is there to ensure integrity.
justifications.D:
The message digest does not enable the transmission in digital format; it is there to ensure integrity.
416 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following manages the digital certificate life cycle to ensure that adequate security and controls
exist in digital signature applications related to ecommerce?

justifications.A:
A registration authority is an optional entity that is responsible fbr the administrative tasks associated
with registering the end entity that is the subject of the certificate issued by the certificate (certification)
authority (CA).
justifications.B:
The CA maintains a directory of digital certificates for the reference of those receiving them.
It manages the certificate life cycle, including certificate directory maintenance and certificate
revocation list (CRL) maintenance and publication.
justifications.C:
A CRL is an instrument for checking the continued validity of the certificates fbr which the CA has
responsibility. A certificate that is put on a CRL can no longer be trusted.
justifications.D: A certification practice statement is a detailed set of rules governing the certificate authority's operations.

questions.question:
A Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCPZIP)-based environment is exposed to the Internet.
Which of the following BEST ensures that complete encryption and authentication protocols exist fbr
protecting information while transmitted?

options.A: Work is completed in tunnel mode with internet protocol (IP) security.
options.B: A digital signature with RSA has been implemented.
options.C: Digital certificates with RSA are being used.
options.D: Work is being completed in transmission control protocol (TCP) services.

justifications.A:
Tunnel mode with internet protocol (IP) security provides encryption and authentication of the
complete IP package. To accomplish this, the authentication header and encapsulating security
payload services can be nested. This is known as IP Security.
justifications.B: A digital signature with RSA provides authentication and integrity but not confidentiality.
justifications.C: Digital certificates with RSA provide authentication and integrity but do not provide encryption.
justifications.D:
Transmission Control Protocol services do not provide encryption and authentication.
417
C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Digital signatures require the:

options.A: signer to have a public key and the receiver to have a private key.
options.B: signer to have a private key and the receiver to have a public key.
options.C: signer and receiver to have a public key.
options.D: signer and receiver to have a private key.

justifications.A:
If a sender encrypts a message with a public key, it will provide confidential transmission to the receiver
with the private key.
justifications.B:
Digital signatures are intended to verify to a recipient the integrity of the data and the identity of
the sender The digital signature standard is based on the sender encrypting a digest of the message
with their private key and the receiver validating the message with the public key.
justifications.C:
Asymmetric key cryptography always works with key pairs. Therefore, a message encrypted with a public
key can only be opened with a private key.
justifications.D: If both the sender and receiver have a private key there would be no way to validate the digital signature.

questions.question:
The feature of a digital signature that ensures that the sender cannot later deny generating and sending the
message is called:

justifications.A:
Data integrity refers to changes in the plaintext message that would result in the recipient failing to
compute the same message hash.
justifications.B:
Because only the claimed sender has the private key used to create the digital signature, authentication
ensures that the message has been sent by the claimed sender.
justifications.C:
Integrity, authentication, nonrepudiation and replay protection are all features of a digital
signature. Nonrepudiation ensures that the claimed sender cannot later deny generating and
sending the message.
justifications.D:
Replay protection is a method that a recipient can use to check that the message was not intercepted and
re-sent (replayed).

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
During the collection of forensic evidence, which of the following actions would MOST likely result in the
destruction or corruption of evidence on a compromised system?

options.A: Dumping the memory content to a file
options.B: Generating disk images of the compromised system
options.D: Removing the system from the network

justifications.A:
Copying the memory contents is a normal forensics procedure where possible. Done carefully, it will not
corrupt the evidence.
justifications.B:
Proper forensics procedures require creating two copies of the images of the system fbr analysis. Hash
values ensure that the copies are accurate.
justifications.C:
Rebooting the system may result in a change in the system state and the loss of files and important
evidence stored in memory.
justifications.D:
When investigating a system, it is recommended to disconnect it from the network to minimize external
infection or access.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing Transport Layer Security enabled websites fbr the
enterprise. Which of the following choices would be the HIGHEST risk?

options.C: Using the same digital certificate fbr multiple websites

justifications.A:
An expired certificate leads to blocked access to the website, leading to unwanted downtime. However,
there is no loss of data. Therefore, the comparative risk is lower.
justifications.B:
Self-signed digital certificates are not signed by a certificate (certification) authority (CA) and can
be created by anyone. Thus, they can be used by attackers to impersonate a website, which may
lead to data theft or perpetrate a man-in-the-middle attack.
justifications.C:
Using the same digital certificate is not a significant risk. Wildcard digital certificates may be used for
multiple subdomain websites.
justifications.D:
56-bit digital certificates may be needed to connect with older versions of operating system (OS) or
browsers. Although they have a lower strength than 128-bit or 256-bit digital certificates, the comparative
risk of a self-signed certificate is higher.
419

questions.question: Which of the following controls would BEST detect intrusion?

options.A: User IDs and user privileges are granted through authorized procedures.
options.B: Automatic logoff is used when a workstation is inactive for a particular period of time.
options.C: Automatic logoff of the system occurs after a specified number of unsuccessful attempts.
options.D: Unsuccessful logon attempts are monitored by the security administrator.

justifications.A:
User IDs and the granting of user privileges define a policy. This is a type of administrative or managerial
control that may prevent intrusion but would not detect it.
justifications.B:
Automatic logoff is a method of preventing access through unattended or inactive terminals but is not a
detective control.
justifications.C: Unsuccessful attempts to log on are a method fbr preventing intrusion, not detecting it.
justifications.D: Intrusion is detected by the active monitoring and review of unsuccessful logon attempts.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST control over a guest wireless ID that is given to vendor staff?

options.A: Assignment of a renewable user ID that expires daily.
options.B: A write-once log to monitor the vendor's activities on the system.
options.C: Use of a user ID format similar to that used by employees.
options.D: Ensuring that wireless network encryption is configured properly.

justifications.A:
A renewable user ID that expires daily is a good control because it ensures that wireless access will
automatically terminate daily and cannot be used without authorization.
justifications.B:
Although it is recommended to monitor vendor activities while vendor staff are on the system, this is a
detective control and, thus, is not as strong as a preventive control.
justifications.C: The user ID format does not change the overall security of the wireless connection.
justifications.D:
Controls related to the encryption of the wireless network are important; however, access to that network
is a more critical issue.

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor suspects an incident is occurring while an audit is being performed on a
financial system. What should the IS auditor do FIRST?

options.A: Request that the system be shut down to preserve evidence.
options.C: Ask for immediate suspension of the suspect accounts.
options.D: Investigate the source and nature of the incident.

justifications.A:
The information systems (IS) auditor should follow the incident response process of the organization. The
auditor is not authorized to shut the system down.
justifications.B:
Reporting the suspected incident to management will help initiate the incident response process,
which is the most appropriate action. Management is responsible for making decisions regarding
the appropriate response. It is not the IS auditor's role to respond to incidents during an audit.
justifications.C:
The IS auditor is not authorized to lead the investigation or to suspend user accounts. The auditor should
report the incident to management.
justifications.D:
Management is responsible fbr setting up and following an incident management plan; that is not the
responsibility of the IS auditor.

questions.question: When using public key encryption to secure data being transmitted across a network:

options.A: the keys used to encrypt and decrypt the data are public.
options.B: the key used to encrypt the data is private, but the key used to decrypt the data is public.
options.C: the key used to encrypt the data is public, but the key used to decrypt the data is private.
options.D: the keys used to encrypt and decrypt the data are private.

justifications.A:
The public and private keys always work as a pair—if a public key is used to encrypt a message, the
corresponding private key MUST be used to decrypt the message.
justifications.B:
If the message is encrypted with a private key, that will provide proof of origin but not message security
or confidentiality.
justifications.C:
Public key encryption, also known as asymmetric key cryptography, uses a public key to encrypt
the message and a private key to decrypt it.
justifications.D: Using two private keys is not possible with asymmetric encryption.

questions.question: The technique used to ensure security in virtual private networks is called:

justifications.A:
Encapsulation, or tunneling, is a technique used to encrypt the traffic payload so that it can be
securely transmitted over an insecure network.
justifications.B:
Wrapping is used where the original packet is wrapped in another packet but is not directly related to
security.
justifications.C: To transform or change the state of communication is not used for security.
justifications.D: Hashing is used in virtual private networks to ensure message integrity.

questions.question:
During an audit of an enterprise that is dedicated to ecommerce, the information systems (IS) manager states
that digital signatures are used when receiving communications from customers. To substantiate this, an IS
auditor must prove that which of the following is used?

options.A: A biometric, digitalized and encrypted parameter with the customer's public key.
options.B: A hash of the data that is transmitted and encrypted with the customer's private key.
options.C: A hash of the data that is transmitted and encrypted with the customer's public key.
options.D: The customer's scanned signature encrypted with the customer's public key.

justifications.A: Biometrics are not used in digital signatures or public key encryption.
justifications.B:
The calculation of a hash, or digest, of the data that are transmitted, and its encryption require the
private key of the client (sender) and is called a signature of the message, or digital signature. The
receiver hashes the received message and compares the hash that they compute with the received
hash, after the digital signature has been decrypted with the sender's public key. If the hash values
are the same, the conclusion is that there is integrity in the data that have arrived, and the origin
is authenticated. The concept of encrypting the hash with the private key of the originator provides
nonrepudiation because it can only be decrypted with their public key, and the private key would
not be known to the recipient. Simply put, in a key-pair situation, anything that can be decrypted
by a sender's public key must have been encrypted with their private key, so they must have been
the sender (i.e., nonrepudiation).
justifications.C:
It is not correct to encrypt the hash with the customer's public key because the recipient would need
access to the customer's private key to decrypt the digital signature.
justifications.D:
A scan of the customer's signature is known as a digitized signature, not a digital signature, and is of little
or no value in this scenario.

questions.question:

questions.question: Email message authenticity and confidentiality is BEST achieved by signing the message using the:

options.A: sender's private key and encrypting the message using the receiver's public key.
options.B: sender's public key and encrypting the message using the receiver's private key.
options.C: receiver's private key and encrypting the message using the sender's public key.
options.D: receiver's public key and encrypting the message using the sender's private key.

justifications.A:
By signing the message with the sender's private key, the receiver can verify its authenticity using
the sender's public key. Encrypting with the receiver's public key provides confidentiality.
justifications.B: Signing can only occur using the sender's private key.
justifications.C: The sender does not have access to the receiver's private key.
justifications.D:
By encrypting the message with the receiver's public key, only the receiver can decrypt the message using
their own private key. The receiver's private key is confidential and, therefore, unknown to the sender.
Messages encrypted using the sender's private key can be read by anyone with the sender's public key.

questions.question:
An organization is considering connecting a critical PC-based system to the Internet. Which of the following
provides the BEST protection against hacking?

justifications.A:
An application-level gateway is the best way to protect against hacking because it can be configured
with detailed rules that describe the type of user or connection that is or is not permitted.
It analyzes, in detail, each package—not only in layers one through four of the Open System
Interconnection model, but also layers five through seven, which means that it reviews the
commands of each higher-level protocol (Hypertext Transmission Protocol, File Transfer Protocol,
Simple Network Management Protocol, etc.).
justifications.B:
For a remote access server, there is a device (server) that asks fbr a username and password before
entering the network. This is good when accessing private networks, but it can be mapped or scanned
from the Internet, creating security exposure.
justifications.C:
Proxy servers can provide excellent protection, but depending on the type of proxy, they may not be able
to examine traffic as effectively as an application gateway. Proxy servers require experienced personnel to
manage them. Applications can use different ports for the different sections of the program.
justifications.D:
Port scanning is used to detect vulnerabilities or open ports on a network, but not when trying to control
what comes from the Internet or when all the ports available need to be controlled. For example, the port
fbr Ping (echo request) can be blocked and the internet protocol (IP) addresses would be available fbr the
application and browsing but would not respond to Ping.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor performing an audit has determined that developers have been granted
administrative access to the virtual machine management console to manage their own servers used for
software development and testing. Which of the following choices is the PRIMARY concern fbr the IS
auditor?

options.A: Developers can create or de-provision servers.
options.B: Developers can gain elevated access to production servers.
options.C: Developers can affect the performance of production servers with their applications.
options.D: Developers can install unapproved applications to any servers.

justifications.A:
Virtualization offers the ability to create or destroy virtual machine (VM) through the
administrative interface with administrative access. Although a developer is unlikely to de­
provision a production server, the administrative console would grant them the ability to do this,
which would be a significant risk.
justifications.B:
When properly configured, the administrative console of a virtual server host does not allow an individual
to bypass the authentication of the guest operating system (OS) to access the server. In this case, although
the developers can potentially start, stop or even de-provision a production VM, they cannot gain elevated
access to the OS of the guest through the administrative interface.
justifications.C:
Although there can be instances where a software development team might use resource-intensive
applications that can cause performance issues fbr the virtual host, the greater risk is the ability to
de-provision VMs.
justifications.D:
When properly configured, the administrative console of a virtual server host does not allow an individual
to bypass the authentication of the guest OS to access the server; therefore, the concern that unauthorized
software can be installed is not valid.

options.C: The change control team has knowledge of the application ID password.
options.D: The application does not enforce the use of strong passwords.

Developers might need limited update access to production data to perform their jobs, and this access,
when approved and reviewed by management, is acceptable even though it does pose a risk.
justifications.B:
A debugging tool displays the execution of a program step by step and allows the user to modify
data during execution. Using such a tool in production may result in unauthorized modification of
production data.
justifications.C:
Knowledge of the application ID password by the change control team does not pose a great concern if
adequate separation of duties exists between change control and development activities. There may be
occasions when the application ID needs to be used by change control in the production environment.
justifications.D:
Although the lack of a strong password policy and configuration can result in compromised accounts, the
risk is lower than if the application ID password is compromised because the application ID password
does not allow fbr traceability.

questions.question:
The management of an enterprise has decided to establish a security awareness program. Which of the

options.B: Mandating the use of passwords to access all software.

questions.question:
An enterprise determined that its website was compromised, and a rootkit was installed on the server hosting
the application. Which of the following choices would have MOST likely prevented the incident?

justifications.A:
A host-based intrusion prevention system (IPS) prevents unauthorized changes to the host If a
malware attack attempted to install a rootkit, the IPS would refuse to permit the installation
without the consent of an administrator
justifications.B:
A network-based intrusion detection system (IDS) relies on attack signatures based on known exploits
and attack patterns. If the IDS is not kept up-to-date with the latest signatures, or the attacker is able

would not appear to be an attack to the network-based IDS.

Operating system (OS) patching makes exploitation of the server more difficult for the attacker and less
likely. However, attacks on the web application and server OS may succeed based on issues unrelated to
any unpatched server vulnerabilities, and the host-based IPS should detect any attempts to change files on
the server, regardless of how access was obtained.

questions.question:
Which of the following types of penetration tests effectively evaluates the incident handling and response
capability of the system administrator?

and the targefs IT team is aware of the testing activities.
justifications.B:

perimeter. The system administrator is typically aware of the testing activities.
justifications.C:
In double-blind testing, the penetration tester has little or limited knowledge about the target
system, and personnel at the target site are not informed that a test is being performed. Because the

incident handling and response capability of the system administrator.

from outside the target system. The system administrator may or may not be aware of the testing

questions.question:
An organization has experienced a large amount of traffic being re-routed from its Vbice-over Internet
Protocol packet network. The organization believes it is a victim of eavesdropping. Which of the following
can result in eavesdropping of Vbice-over Internet Protocol (VoIP) traffic?

options.A: Corruption of the Address Resolution Protocol cache in Ethernet switches
options.B: Use of a default administrator password on the analog phone switch
options.C: Deploying virtual local area networks VLANs without enabling encryption
options.D: End users having access to software tools such as packet sniffer applications

justifications.A:
On an Ethernet switch, there is a data table known as the address resolution protocol (ARP)
cache that stores mappings between media access control and internet protocol (IP) addresses.
During normal operations, Ethernet switches only allow directed traffic to flow between the ports
involved in the conversation and no other ports can see that traffic. However, if the ARP cache
is intentionally corrupted with an ARP poisoning attack, some Ethernet switches simply flood
the directed traffic to all ports of the switch, which can allow an attacker to monitor traffic not
normally visible to the port where the attacker was connected, and thereby eavesdrop on Voice-over
Internet Protocol (VoIP) traffic.
justifications.B: VblP systems do not use analog switches and inadequate administrator security controls are not an issue.
justifications.C:
VblP data are not normally encrypted in a local area network (LAN) environment because the controls
regarding virtual local area network (VLAN) security are adequate.
justifications.D:
Most software tools, such as packet sniffers, cannot make changes to LAN devices, such as the VLAN
configuration of an Ethernet switch used for VblP. Therefore, the use of software utilities of this type is
not a risk.

questions.question:

questions.question:

justifications.B:

attacks.
justifications.C: A neural network combines statistical- and signature-based IDSs to create a hybrid and better system.

questions.question:

questions.question:

questions.question:

questions.question:

justifications.D:

questions.question:
An organization with extremely high security requirements is evaluating the effectiveness of biometric
systems. Which of the following performance indicators is MOST important?

justifications.A:
False-acceptance rate (FAR) is the frequency of accepting an unauthorized person as authorized,
thereby granting access when it should be denied. In an enterprise with high security requirements,
limiting the number of false acceptances is more important than the impact on the false reject rate.
justifications.B:
Equal-error rate EER (also called the crossover error rate) is the point where the FAR equals the
false-rejection rate (FRR). This is the criteria used to measure the optimal accuracy of the biometric
system, but, in a highly secure environment, the FAR is more important than the EER.
justifications.C:
FRR denies an authorized person access, but this is less important than the FAR because it is better to
deny access to an authorized individual than to grant access to an unauthorized individual.
justifications.D:
False-identification rate (FIR) is the probability that an authorized person is identified but is assigned a
false ID.

questions.question: Which of the following antispam filtering methods has the LOWEST possibility of false-positive alerts?

justifications.A: Rule-based filtering will trigger false-positive alert each time a key word is met in the message.
justifications.B:
The advantage of this type of checksum-based filtering is that it lets ordinary users help

disadvantage is that spammers can insert unique invisible gibberish一known as hashbusters—into

considered a shortcut.

message as a whole. Therefore, it can ignore a suspicious keyword if the entire message is within normal
bounds. However, statistical filtering is prone to false-positive alerts.

ABC connect over the Internet fbr production support to XYZ?

justifications.A:
Single sign-on (SSO) authentication provides a single access point to system resources. It is not best in
this situation.
justifications.B:
Although password complexity requirements would help prevent unauthorized access, two-factor
authentication is a more effective control for this scenario.
justifications.C:
Multifector authentication (MFA) is the best method to provide a secure connection because it uses
multiple factors, typically, what you have (e.g., a device to generate one-time passwords), what you
are (e.g., biometric characteristics) or what you know (e.g., a personal identification number or
password). Using a password without the use of one or more of the other factors is not the best
method for this scenario.
justifications.D:
Internet Protocol (IP) addresses can always change or be spoofed and, therefore, are not the best form of
authentication fbr the scenario.

questions.question:
Enterprise XYZ has outsourced production support to service provider ABC, located in another country. The
ABC service provider personnel remotely connect to the enterprise network of the XYZ outsourcing entity
over the Internet. Which of the following would BEST provide assurance that transmission of information is
secure while the production support team at ABC is providing support to XYZ?

options.B: Dynamic internet protocol (IP) address and port

justifications.A:
Secret key encryption requires sharing of the same key at the source and destination and involves an
additional step for encrypting and decrypting data at each end. This is not a feasible solution given the
scenario.
justifications.B:
Using a dynamic internet protocol (IP) address and port is not an effective control, because an attacker
can easily find the new address using the domain name system.
justifications.C:
Although the use of a cryptographic hash function may be helpful to validate the integrity of data files, in
this case, it is not useful for a production support team connecting remotely.
justifications.D:
Because ABC and XYZ are communicating over the Internet, which is an untrusted network,
establishing an encrypted virtual private network (VPN) tunnel best ensures that the transmission
of information is secure.

questions.question:
Which of the following is a control that can be implemented to reduce risk of internal fraud if application
programmers are allowed to move programs into the production environment in a small enterprise?

justifications.A:

the end user without detecting the undocumented functionality.
justifications.B:
An independent review of the changes to the program in production can identify potential
unauthorized changes, versions or functionality that the programmer put into production.
justifications.C:
An independent review of user requirements is not as effective, because the system can meet user
requirements and still include undocumented functionalities.
justifications.D:
An independent review of user acceptance is not as effective because the system can be accepted by the
end users, and the undocumented functionalities can remain undetected.

questions.question: A characteristic of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) in network communications is:

options.A: packets may arrive out of order.
options.D: error correction may slow down processing.

justifications.A:
User Datagram Protocol (UDP) uses a simple transmission model without implicit handshaking
routines for providing reliability, ordering or data integrity. Thus, UDP provides an unreliable
service, and datagrams may arrive out of order, appear duplicated or get dropped.
justifications.B:
The advantage of UDP is that the lack of error checking allows fbr reduced latency. Time-sensitive
applications, such as online video or audio, often use UDP because of the reduced latency of this protocol.
justifications.C:
UDP is compatible with packet broadcast (sending to all on the local network) and multicasting (sending
to all subscribers).
justifications.D:
UDP assumes that error checking and correction is either not necessary or performed in the application,
avoiding the overhead of such processing at the network interface level.

questions.question:
Which of the following choices is the MOST effective control that should be implemented to ensure
accountability for application users accessing sensitive data in the human resource management system
(HRMS) and among interfacing applications to the HRMS?

justifications.A:
Two-factor authentication would enhance security while logging into the human resource management
system application; however, it will not establish accountability fbr actions taken subsequent to login.
justifications.B:
A digital certificate will enhance login security to conclusively authenticate users logging in to the
application. However, it will not establish accountability, because user ID and transaction details will not
be captured without an audit trail.
justifications.C:
Audit trails capture which user performed the transaction, at what time date, and other details, and
this helps in establishing accountability among application users.
justifications.D:
Single sign-on (SSO) authentication allows users to log in seamlessly to the application, thus easing the
authentication process. However, this does not also establish accountability.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing wireless network security determines that the Dynamic Host
Configuration Protocol is disabled at all wireless access points. This practice:

options.A: reduces the risk of unauthorized access to the network.
options.B: is not suitable for small networks.
options.C: automatically provides an internet protocol (IP) address to anyone.
options.D: increases the risk associated with Wireless Encryption Protocol.

justifications.A:
Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) automatically assigns internet protocol (IP)
addresses to anyone connecting to the network. With DHCP disabled, static IP addresses must
be used, and this requires either administrator support or a higher level of technical skill to attach
to the network and gain Internet access.
justifications.B: DHCP is suitable fbr networks of all sizes from home networks to large complex organizations.
justifications.C: DHCP does not provide IP addresses when disabled.
justifications.D:
Disabling the DHCP makes it more difficult to exploit the well-known weaknesses in Wireless Encryption
Protocol.

questions.question:
Which of the following is MOST indicative of the effectiveness of an information security awareness
program?

options.A: Employees report more information regarding security incidents.
options.B: All employees have signed the information security policy.
options.C: Most employees have attended an awareness session.
options.D: Information security responsibilities have been included in job descriptions.

justifications.A:
Although the promotion of security awareness is a preventive control, it can also be a detective
measure because it encourages people to identify and report possible security violations. The
reporting of incidents implies that employees are acting because of the awareness program.
justifications.B:
The existence of evidence that all employees have signed the security policy does not ensure that security
responsibilities have been understood and applied.
justifications.C:
One of the objectives of the security awareness program is to inform the employees of what is expected
of them and their responsibilities, but this knowledge does not ensure that employees will perform their
activities in a secure manner.
justifications.D:
The documentation of roles and responsibilities in job descriptions is not an indicator of the effectiveness
of the awareness program.

questions.question:
An enterprise stores and transmits sensitive customer information within a secure wired network. It has
implemented an additional wireless local area network (WLAN) to support general-purpose staff computing
needs. A few employees with WLAN access have legitimate business reasons fbr also accessing customer
information. Which of the following represents the BEST control to ensure separation of the two networks?

options.B: Implement virtual local area network (VLAN) segmentation.
options.C: Install a dedicated router between the two networks.
options.D: Install a firewall between the networks.

justifications.A:
Although having two physically separate networks ensures the security of customer data, it makes it
impossible fbr authorized wireless users to access that data.
justifications.B:
Although a virtual local area network (VLAN) would provide separation of the two networks, it is
possible, with sufficient knowledge, fbr an attacker to gain access to one VLAN from the other.
justifications.C:
A dedicated router between the two networks would separate them; however, this would be less secure
than a firewall.
justifications.D:
In this case, a firewall can be used as a strong control to allow authorized users on the wireless
network to access the wired network.

questions.question: From a control perspective, the PRIMARY objective of classifying information assets is to:

options.A: establish guidelines fbr the level of access controls that should be assigned.
options.B: ensure access controls are assigned to all information assets.
options.C: assist management and auditors in risk assessment.
options.D: identify which assets need to be insured against losses.

justifications.A:
Information has varying degrees of sensitivity and criticality in meeting business objectives. By
assigning classes or levels of sensitivity and criticality to information resources, management can
establish guidelines for the level of access controls that should be assigned. End user management
and the security administrator will use these classifications in their risk assessment process to
assign a given class to each asset.
justifications.B:
Not all information needs to be protected through access controls. Overprotecting data would be
expensive.
justifications.C: The classification of information is usually based on the risk assessment, not the other way around.
justifications.D:
Insuring assets is valid; however, this is not the primary objective of information classification.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing access controls for a client-server environment should FIRST:

justifications.A: Evaluating encryption techniques would be performed at a later stage of the review.
justifications.B:
A client-server environment typically contains several access points and uses distributed
techniques, increasing the risk of unauthorized access to data and processing. To evaluate the
security of the client server environment, all network access points should be identified.
justifications.C: Reviewing the identity management system would be performed at a later stage of the review.
justifications.D: Reviewing the application-level access controls would be performed at a later stage of the review.

questions.question:
To prevent internet protocol (IP) spoofing attacks, a firewall should be configured to drop a packet fbr which
the sender of a packet:

options.A: specifies the route that a packet should take through the network (the source routing field is enabled).
options.B: puts multiple destination hosts (the destination field has a broadcast address).
options.C:
indicates that the computer should immediately stop using the transmission control protocol (TCP)
connection (a reset flag is turned on).
options.D: allows use of dynamic routing instead of static routing (Open Shortest Path First protocol is enabled).

justifications.A:
internet protocol (IP) spoofing takes advantage of the source-routing option in the IP. With this
option enabled, an attacker can insert a spoofed source IP address. The packet will travel the
network according to the information within the source-routing field, bypassing the logic in each
router, including dynamic and static routing.
justifications.B:
If a packet has a broadcast destination address, it is suspicious and, if allowed to pass, will be sent to all
addresses in the subnet. This is not related to IP spoofing.
justifications.C:
Turning on the reset flag is part of the normal procedure to end a transmission control protocol (TCP)
connection.
justifications.D:
The use of dynamic or static routing does not represent a spoofing attack.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing a manufacturing enterprise and finds that mainframe users
at a remote site connect to the mainframe at headquarters over the Internet via Telnet. Which of the following
offers the STRONGEST security?

options.A: Use of a point-to-point leased line
options.B: Use of a firewall rule to allow only the internet protocol (IP) address of the remote site
options.D: Use of a nonstandard port fbr Telnet

justifications.A:
A leased line effectively extends the local area network of the headquarters to the remote site, and
the mainframe Telnet connection travels over the private line, which is less of a security risk when
using an insecure protocol such as Telnet.
justifications.B:
A firewall rule at the headquarters network to only allow Telnet connections from the internet protocol
(IP) address assigned to the remote site makes the connection more secure than the current arrangement,
but a dedicated leased line is the most secure option of those listed.
justifications.C:
Although two-factor authentication enhances the login security, it does not secure the transmission
channel against eavesdropping, and, therefore, a leased line is a better option.
justifications.D:
Attacks on network services start with the assumption that network services use the standard
Transmission Control Protocol/Intemet Protocol (TCP/IP) port number assigned for the service, which
is port 23 for Telnet. By reconfiguring the host and client, a different port can be used. Assigning a
nonstandard port for services is a good general security practice because it makes it more difficult to
determine what service is using the port; however, in this case, creating a leased-line connection to the
remote site is a better solution.

questions.question:
There is a concern that the risk of unauthorized access may increase after implementing a single sign-on
(SSO) process. To prevent unauthorized access, the MOST important action is to:

justifications.A:
Ensuring that all failed authentication attempts are monitored is a good practice but is not a preventive
control.
justifications.B:
Reviewing the log files can increase the probability of detecting unauthorized access but does not prevent
unauthorized access.
justifications.C:
Ensuring that all unused accounts are deactivated is important; however, unauthorized access may occur
via a regularly used account.
justifications.D:
Strong passwords are important in any environment but take on special importance in an single
sign-on (SSO) environment, where a user enters a password only one time and thereafter has
general access throughout the environment. Of the options given, only a strong password policy
offers broad preventative effects.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing the implementation of an intrusion detection system (IDS)
should be MOST concerned if:

options.A: IDS sensors are placed outside of the firewall.
options.B: a behavior-based IDS is causing many false alarms.
options.C: a signature-based IDS is weak against new types of attacks.
options.D: the IDS is used to detect encrypted traffic.

justifications.A:
An organization can place sensors outside of the firewall to detect attacks. These sensors are placed in
highly sensitive areas and on extranets.
justifications.B:
An excessive number of false alarms from a behavior-based intrusion detection system (IDS)
indicates that additional tuning is needed. False positives cannot be eliminated entirely, but ignoring
this warning sign may negate the value of the system by causing those responsible for monitoring its
warnings to become convinced that anything reported is false.
justifications.C:
Being weak against new types of attacks is expected from a signature-based IDS because it can only
recognize attacks that have been previously identified.
justifications.D:
An IDS cannot detect attacks within encrypted traffic, but there may be good reason to detect the presence
of encrypted traffic, such as when a next-generation firewall is configured to terminate encrypted
connections at the perimeter. In such cases, detecting encrypted packets flowing past the firewall can
indicate improper configuration or even a compromise of the firewall itself.

options.A: Encrypts the information transmitted over the network
options.B: Makes other users' certificates available to applications
options.C: Facilitates the implementation of a password policy

justifications.B: A directory server makes other users9 certificates available to applications.
justifications.C: Facilitating the implementation of a password policy is not relevant to public key infrastructure.
justifications.D:
Storing certificate revocation lists is a role performed by a security server.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing an enterprise's network operations center (NOC). Which of
the following choices is of the GREATEST concern? The use of:

options.A: a wet pipe-based fire suppression system.
options.B: a rented rack space in the NOC.
options.D: an uninterrupted power supply with 10 minutes of backup power.

justifications.A:
Wet pipe systems may damage computer equipment, but they are safe fbr humans and not as damaging as
carbon dioxide (CO2) systems.
justifications.B:
Rented rack space is not a concern if security controls are maintained. Most organizations rent server rack
space.
justifications.C:
CO2 systems should not be used in areas where people are present, because their function will cause
suffocation in the event of a fire. Controls should consider personnel safety first.
justifications.D:
Depending on the system, a few minutes might be all that is needed fbr a graceful shutdown. However, a
CO2 system is dangerous fbr personnel.

questions.question:
During an access control review for a mainframe application, an information systems (IS) auditor discovers
user security groups without designated owners. The PRIMARY reason that this is a concern to the IS auditor
is that, without ownership, there is no one with clear responsibility fbr:

justifications.A: Updating data about the group is not a great concern when compared to unauthorized access.
justifications.B:
Although the periodic review of user accounts is a good practice, this is a detective control and not as
robust as preventing unauthorized access to the group in the first place.
justifications.C:
Without an owner to provide approval for user access to the group, unauthorized individuals can
potentially gain access to any sensitive data within the rights of the group.
justifications.D:
Revoking access to terminated users is a compensating control fbr the normal termination process and is
also a detective control.

questions.question: The PRIMARY goal of using maturity models in (information systems (IS)) is to:

options.A: measure the current maturity levels of a certain aspect of an IS organization in a meaningful way.
options.B: prioritize what the organization should do to reach higher maturity levels.
options.C: help gain senior management understanding, commitment and support fbr IS.
options.D: enable stakeholders to clearly identify strengths and areas of improvement.

Measuring and assessing the maturity levels enable stakeholders to clearly identify strengths and areas of
improvement in information systems (IS).
justifications.B: Prioritizing the improvement initiatives comes after knowing what parts of IS need attention first.
justifications.C:
Gaining senior management support comes after measuring the maturity levels, identifying areas of
improvement and prioritizing improvement initiatives.
justifications.D:
The main purpose of using maturity models is to enable stakeholders to clearly identify strengths
and areas of improvement in IS after assessing the current maturity levels and to prioritize the
improvement initiatives before gaining senior management support.

questions.question: When installing an intrusion detection system (IDS), which of the following is MOST important?

options.A: Properly locating it in the network architecture
options.C: Identifying messages that need to be quarantined

justifications.A:
Properly locating an intrusion detection system (IDS) in the network is the most important step
during installation. A poorly located IDS can leave key areas of the network unprotected.
justifications.B:
A network IDS monitors network traffic and a host-based IDS monitors activity on the host, but it has no
capability of preventing a denial-of-service (DoS) attack.
justifications.C:
Configuring an IDS can be a challenge because it may require the IDS to learn what normal activity is,
but the most important part of the installation is to install it in the right places.
justifications.D:
An IDS is only a monitoring device and does not reject traffic. Rejection errors apply to a biometric
device.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST criterion for evaluating the adequacy of an enterprise\ security
awareness program?

options.A:
Senior management is aware of critical information assets and demonstrates an adequate concern fbr their
protection.
options.B: Job descriptions contain clear statements of accountability for information security.
options.C: In accordance with the degree of risk and business impact, there is adequate funding for security efforts.
options.D: No actual incidents have occurred that have caused a loss or a public embarrassment.

justifications.A:
Senior managemenfs level of awareness and concern for information assets is a criterion for evaluating
the importance that they attach to those assets and their protection, but it is not as meaningful as having
job descriptions that require all staff to be responsible fbr information security.
justifications.B:
The inclusion of security responsibilities in job descriptions is a key factor in demonstrating the
maturity of the security program and helps ensure that staff and management are aware of their
roles with respect to information security.
justifications.C:
Funding is important but having funding does not ensure that the security program is effective or
adequate.
justifications.D:
The number of incidents that have occurred is a criterion fbr evaluating the adequacy of the risk
management program, but it is not a criterion fbr evaluating a security program.

questions.question:
Which of the following features of a public key infrastructure is MOST closely associated with proving that
an online transaction was authorized by a specific customer?

justifications.A:
Nonrepudiation, achieved with digital signatures, prevents the senders from later denying that they

justifications.C:

justifications.D: Integrity ensures that transactions are accurate but does not provide the identification of the customer.

questions.question:
After reviewing its business processes, a large enterprise is deploying a new web application based on
Voice-over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technology. Which of the following is the MOST appropriate approach
fbr implementing access control that will facilitate security management of the VblP web application?

Fine-grained access control on VoIP web applications does not scale to enterprisewide systems because it
is primarily based on individual user identities and their specific technical privileges.
justifications.B:

justifications.C:
Access control lists on Vbice-over Internet Protocol (VblP) web applications do not scale to
enterprisewide systems because they are primarily based on individual user identities and their specific

justifications.D:

authorization.

questions.question:
During a logical access controls review, an information systems (IS) auditor observes that user accounts are
shared. The GREATEST risk resulting from this situation is that:

options.A: an unauthorized user may use a shared ID to gain access.
options.B: user access management is time consuming.

justifications.A:
The risk of an unauthorized user accessing the system with a shared ID is no greater than an unauthorized
user accessing the system with a unique user ID.
justifications.B: Access management would not be any different with shared IDs.
justifications.C:
The use of a single user ID by more than one individual precludes knowing who, in fact, used that
ID to access a system; therefore, it is more difficult to hold anyone accountable.
justifications.D: B. Access management would not be any different with shared IDs.

questions.question:
To protect a Voice-over Internet Protocol (VblP) infrastructure against a denial-ofservice (DoS) attack, it is
MOST important to secure the:

justifications.A:
Securing the access control server may prevent account alteration or lockout but is not the primary
protection against denial-of-service (DoS) attacks.
justifications.B:
Session border controllers enhance security in the access network and in the core. In the access
network, they hide a user's real address and provide a managed public address. This public address
can be monitored, minimizing the opportunities for scanning and DoS attacks. Session border
controllers permit access to clients behind firewalls while maintaining the firewalFs effectiveness. In
the core, session border controllers protect the users and the network. They hide network topology
and users' real addresses. They can also monitor bandwidth and quality of service.
justifications.C:
Backbone gateways are isolated and not readily accessible to hackers, so this is not a location of DoS
attacks.
justifications.D:
Intrusion detection systems (IDSs) monitor traffic, but do not protect against DoS attacks.

questions.question: In an online banking application, which of the following would BEST protect against identity theft?

justifications.D: Periodic review of access logs is a detective control and does not protect against identity theft.

An information systems (IS) auditor found that employees are emailing sensitive enterprise information to

questions.question:
A web server is attacked and compromised. Enterprise policy states that incident response should balance
containment of an attack with retaining freedom for later legal action against an attacker. Under the
circumstances, which of the following should be performed FIRST?

options.A: Dump the volatile storage data to a disk.
options.B: Run the server in a fail-safe mode.

The first action is to disconnect the web server from the network to secure the device for

questions.question: What is the BEST approach to mitigate the risk of a phishing attack?

justifications.A:

activity but are not generally effective against phishing attacks.
justifications.B:

justifications.C:

cannot mitigate most types of phishing attacks.

A key IT systems developer has suddenly resigned from an enterprise. Which of the following will be the

options.A: Set up an exit interview with human resources.
options.B: Initiate the handover process to ensure continuity of the project.
options.C: Terminate the developer's logical access to IT resources.

To protect IT assets, terminating logical access to IT resources is the first and most important

enterprise.

terminating access to the IT systems.

questions.question: Which of the following is a passive attack to a network?

justifications.A:

justifications.B: Masquerading is an active attack in which the intruder presents an identity other than the original identity.

questions.question:
An enterprise is planning to install a network-based intrusion detection system (IDS) to protect the website
that it hosts. Where should the device be installed?

options.D: On the server that hosts the website

justifications.A:
Although an intrusion detection system (IDS) can be installed on the local network to ensure that systems
are not subject to internal attacks, an enterprise's public web server would not normally be installed on the
local network, but rather in the demilitarized zone (DMZ).
justifications.B:
It is not unusual to place a network IDS outside of the firewall just to watch the traffic that is reaching the
firewall, but this would not be used to specifically protect the web application.
justifications.C:
Network-based IDSs detect attack attempts by monitoring network traffic. A public web server
is typically placed on the protected network segment known as the DMZ. An IDS installed in
the DMZ detects and reports on malicious activity originating from the Internet and the internal
network, thus allowing the administrator to act.
justifications.D: A host-based IDS would be installed on the web server, but a network-based IDS would not.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is evaluating a virtual-machine-based architecture used fbr all
programming and testing environments. The production architecture is a three-tier physical architecture. What
is the MOST important IT control to test to ensure availability and confidentiality of the web application in
production?

options.A: Server configuration has been hardened appropriately.
options.C: System administrators are trained to use the virtual machine (VM) architecture.
options.D: The VM server is included in the disaster recovery plan.

justifications.A:
The most important control to test in this configuration is the server configuration hardening.
It is important to patch known vulnerabilities and to disable all nonrequired functions before
production, especially when production architecture is different from development and testing
architecture.
justifications.B:
The greatest risk is associated with the difference between the testing and production environments.
Ensuring that physical resources are available is a relatively low risk and easily addressed.
justifications.C:
Virtual machines (VMs) are often used fbr optimizing programming and testing infrastructure. In this
scenario, the development environment (VM architecture) is different from the production infrastructure
(physical three-tier). Because the VMs are not related to the web application in production, there is no real
requirement for the system administrators to be familiar with a virtual environment.
justifications.D:
Because the VMs are only used in a development environment and not in production, it may not be
necessary to include VMs in the disaster recovery plan.
473
