questions.question: In what capacity would an information systems (IS) auditor MOST likely see a hash function applied?

justifications.A:
The purpose of a hash function is to produce a fingerprint of data that can be used to ensure
integrity and authentication. A hash of a password also provides fbr authentication of a user or
process attempting to access resources.
justifications.B: Hash functions are not used fbr identification. They are used to validate the authenticity of the identity.
justifications.C:
Hash functions are not typically used to provide authorization. Authorization is provided after the
authentication has been established.
justifications.D: Hash functions do not encrypt data.

questions.question:
The BEST filter rule fbr protecting a network from being used as an amplifier in a denial-of-service attack is
to deny all:

options.A: outgoing traffic with source addresses external to the network.
options.B: incoming traffic with discernible spoofed internet protocol (IP) source addresses.
options.C: incoming traffic that includes options set in the Internet Protocol.
options.D: incoming traffic whose destination address belongs to critical hosts.

justifications.A:
Outgoing traffic with an internet protocol (IP) source address different than the internal IP range
in the network is invalid. In most cases, it signals a denial-of-service attack originated by an
internal user or by a previously compromised internal machine; in both cases, applying this filter
will stop the infected machine from participating in the attack.
justifications.B:
Denying incoming traffic does not prevent an internal machine from participating in an attack on an
outside target.
justifications.C: Incoming traffic has the IP options set according to the type of traffic. This is a normal condition.
justifications.D: Denying incoming traffic to internal hosts prevents legitimate traffic.

questions.question: The purpose of a mantrap controlling access to a computer facility is PRIMARILY to:

options.B: prevent toxic gases from entering the data center.
options.D: prevent rapid movement in or out of the facility.

justifications.A:
The intended purpose of a mantrap controlling access to a computer facility is primarily to prevent
piggybacking.
justifications.B: Preventing toxic gases from entering the data center can be accomplished with a single self-closing door.
justifications.C: Starving a fire of oxygen can be accomplished with a single self-closing fire door.
justifications.D:
A rapid exit may be necessary in some circumstances (e.g., a fire).
474 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following should be a concern fbr an infbrmation systems (IS) auditor reviewing an enterprise's
cloud computing strategy that is based on a software as a service (SaaS) model with an external provider?

options.B: Long-term software acquisition costs are higher.
options.C: Contract with the provider does not include onsite technical support.
options.D: Incident handling procedures with the provider are not well defined.

justifications.A:
Unless organization workstations are obsolete, upgrading should not be an issue with a software as a
service (SaaS) model, because most applications running as SaaS use common technologies that allow a
user to run the software on different devices.
justifications.B: The reduction of software acquisition costs is one of the benefits of SaaS.
justifications.C: A SaaS provider does not normally have onsite support fbr the enterprise.
justifications.D:
A SaaS provider does not normally have onsite support for the enterprise. Therefore, incident
handling procedures between the enterprise and its provider are critical for the detection,
communication and resolution of incidents, including effective lines of communication and
escalation processes.

questions.question:
An enterprise has decided to implement an electronic signature scheme based on a public key infrastructure.
The user's private key will be stored on the computer's hard drive and protected by a password. The MOST
significant risk of this approach is:

options.A: use of the user's electronic signature by another person if the password is compromised.
options.B: forgery by using another user's private key to sign a message with an electronic signature.
options.C: impersonation of a user by substitution of the user's public key with another person's public key.
options.D: forgery by substitution of another person's private key on the computer.

justifications.A:
The user's digital signature is only protected by a password. Compromise of the password would
enable access to the signature. This is the most significant risk.
justifications.B:
Creating a digital signature with another user's private key would indicate that the message came from a
different person, and therefore, the true user's credentials would not be forged.
justifications.C:
Impersonation of a public key would require the modification of the certificate issued by the certificate
authority. This is very difficult and least likely.
justifications.D:
The substitution of another person's private key would not work because the digital signature would be
validated with the original user's public key.
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition 475
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following is BEST prevented by a raised floor in the computer machine room?

options.A: Damage of wires around computers and servers
options.B: A power failure from static electricity

justifications.A:
The primary reason for having a raised floor is to enable ventilation systems, power cables and data
cables to be installed underneath the floor This eliminates the safety and damage risk posed when
cables are scattered on an open floor
justifications.B:
Static electricity should be avoided in the machine room; therefore, measures such as specially
manufactured carpet or shoes are more appropriate fbr static prevention than a raised floor.
justifications.C:
Raised floors do not address shocks from earthquakes. To address earthquakes, antiseismic architecture is
required to establish a quake-resistant structural framework.
justifications.D:
Computer equipment needs to be protected against water. However, a raised floor does not prevent
damage to the machines in the event of overhead water pipe leakage.

questions.question:
A business application system accesses an enterprise database using a single ID and password embedded in a
program. Which of the following would provide efficient access control over the enterprise data?

options.A: Introduce a secondary authentication method such as card swipe.
options.B: Apply role-based permissions within the application system.
options.C: Have users input the ID and password fbr each database transaction.
options.D: Set an expiration period for the database password embedded in the program.

justifications.A:
The issue is user permissions, not authentication; therefore, adding stronger authentication does not
improve the situation.
justifications.B:
This is a normal process to allow the application to communicate with the database. Therefore, the
best control is to control access to the application and procedures to ensure that access to data is
granted based on a user's role.
justifications.C:
Having a user input the ID and password for access provides better control because a database log
identifies the initiator of the activity. However, this may not be efficient because each transaction would
require a separate authentication process.
justifications.D:
It is good practice to set an expiration date fbr a password. However, this might not be practical fbr an ID
automatically logged in from the program. Often, this type of password is set not to expire.
476 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor selects a server for a penetration test that will be carried out by a
technical specialist. Which of the following is MOST important?

options.A: The tools used to conduct the test
options.B: Certifications held by the IS auditor
options.C: Permission from the data owner of the server
options.D: An intrusion detection system (IDS) is enabled

justifications.A:
The choice of tools is important to ensure a valid test and prevent system failure; however, the permission
of the owner is most important.
justifications.B:
Whether the information systems (IS) auditor holds certifications is not relevant to the effectiveness of the
test.
justifications.C:
The data owner should be informed of the risk associated with a penetration test, the timing of the
test, what types of tests are to be conducted and other relevant details.
justifications.D: An intrusion detection system (IDS) is not required fbr a penetration test.

questions.question: The GREATEST benefit of having well-defined data classification policies and procedures is:

options.A: a more accurate inventory of information assets.
options.B: a decreased cost and improvement of controls.
options.C: a reduced risk of inappropriate system access.

justifications.A:
A more accurate inventory of information assets is a benefit but is not the greatest benefit of the choices
listed.
justifications.B:
An important benefit of a well-defined data classification process is to lower the cost of protecting
data by ensuring that the appropriate controls are applied with respect to the sensitivity of the data.
Without a proper classification framework, some security controls may be greater and, therefore,
costlier than what is required based on the data classification.
justifications.C:
Classifying the data may assist in reducing the risk of inappropriate system access, but that is not the
greatest benefit.
justifications.D:
Improved regulatory compliance is a benefit; however, achieving a cost reduction is a greater benefit.
477
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following criteria are MOST needed to ensure that log information is admissible in court?
Ensure that data have been:

options.C: encrypted by the most secure algorithm.

justifications.A:
Independent time stamps are a key requirement in logging. This is one method of ensuring log integrity;
however, this does not prevent information from being modified.
justifications.B:
Having multiple logging resources may work to ensure redundancy; however, increased redundancy may
not effectively add value to the credibility of log information.
justifications.C:
The strength of the encryption algorithm may improve data confidentiality; however, this does not
necessarily prevent data from being modified.
justifications.D:
It is important to ensure that log information existed at a certain point of time and it has not been
altered. Therefore, evidential credibility of log information is enhanced when there is proof that
no one has tampered with this information, something typically accomplished by maintaining a
documented chain of custody.

questions.question:
The effectiveness and efficiency of IT governance are dependent FIRST in quality management of:
Options:

justifications.A:
Strategies and policies are the first building blocks of quality management embedded into IT
governance.
justifications.B: Policies are defined first and then should be underpinned by suitable processes and procedures.
justifications.C:
Functions, services and their underpinning processes should be managed and directed by relevant
strategies and policies.
justifications.D:
Roles and responsibilities are articulated based on strategies, policies, processes and procedures.
478 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following controls would be MOST effective in reducing the risk of loss due to fraudulent
online payment requests?

options.B: Protecting web sessions using secure sockets layer (SSL)
options.D: Inputting validation checks on web forms

justifications.A:
An electronic payment system can be the target of fraudulent activities. An unauthorized user can
potentially enter false transactions. By monitoring transactions, the payment processor can identify
potentially fraudulent transactions based on the typical usage patterns, monetary amounts, physical
location of purchases, and other data that are part of the transaction process.
justifications.B:
Using secure sockets layer (SSL) helps to ensure the secure transmission of data to and from the user's
web browser and helps to ensure that the end user has reached the correct web site, but this would not
prevent fraudulent transactions.
justifications.C:
Online transactions are not necessarily protected by passwords; fbr example, credit card transactions are
not necessarily protected. The use of strong authentication helps to protect users of the system from fraud
by attackers guessing passwords, but transaction monitoring is the better control.
justifications.D:
Inputting validation checks on web forms is important to ensure that attackers do not compromise the
website, but transaction monitoring is the best control.

questions.question:
Users are issued security tokens to be used in combination with a personal identification number (PIN) to
access the enterprise virtual private network. Regarding the PIN, what is the MOST important rule to be
included in a security policy?

options.A: Users should not leave tokens where they can be stolen.
options.B: Users must never keep the token in the same bag as their laptop computer.
options.C: Users should select a PIN that is completely random, with no repeating digits.
options.D: Users should never write down their PIN.

justifications.A:
Access to the token is of no value without the personal identification number (PIN); one cannot work
without the other.
justifications.B: Access to the token is of no value without the PIN; one cannot work without the other.
justifications.C: The PIN does not need to be random if it is secret.
justifications.D:
If a user writes their PIN on a slip of paper, an individual with the token, the slip of paper and the
computer can access the enterprise network. A token and the PIN are a two-factor authentication
method.
479
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
A firewall is being deployed at a new location. Which of the following is the MOST important factor in
ensuring a successful deployment?

options.C: Training a local administrator at the new location

justifications.A: A regular review of log files does not start until the deployment has been completed.
justifications.B:
A mistake in the rule set can render a firewall ineffective or insecure. Therefore, testing and
validating the rules is the most important factor in ensuring a successful deployment
justifications.C: Training a local administrator may not be necessary if the firewalls are managed from a central location.
justifications.D: Having multiple administrators is a good idea, but not the most important fbr successful deployment.

questions.question:
A data center has a badge-entry system. Which of the following is MOST important to protect the computing
assets in the center?

options.A: Badge readers are installed in locations where tampering would be noticed.
options.B: The computer that controls the badge system is backed up frequently.
options.C: A process for promptly deactivating lost or stolen badges is followed.
options.D: All badge entry attempts are logged, whether or not they succeed.

justifications.A: Tampering with a badge reader cannot open the door, so this is irrelevant.
justifications.B: The configuration of the system does not change frequently; therefore, frequent backup is not necessary.
justifications.C:
The biggest risk is from unauthorized individuals who can enter the data center, whether they are
employees or not Thus, having and following a process of deactivating lost or stolen badges is
important.
justifications.D:
Logging the entry attempts is important, but not as important as ensuring that a lost or stolen badge is
disabled as quickly as possible.
480 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
What is the MOST prevalent security risk when an organization implements remote virtual private network
(VPN) access to its network?

options.A: Malicious code can be spread across the network.
options.B: The VPN logon can be spoofed.
options.C: Traffic can be sniffed and decrypted.
options.D: The VPN gateway can be compromised.

justifications.A:
Virtual private network (VPN) is a mature technology; VPN devices are hard to break. However,
when remote access is enabled, malicious code in a remote client can spread to the enterprise's
network. One problem is when the VPN terminates inside the network and the encrypted VPN
traffic goes through the firewall. This means that the firewall cannot adequately examine the traffic.
justifications.B: A secure VPN solution uses two-factor authentication to prevent spoofing.
justifications.C: Sniffing encrypted traffic does not generally provide an attack vector fbr its unauthorized decryption.
justifications.D:
A misconfigured or poorly implemented VPN gateway can be subject to attack, but if it is located in a
secure subnet, then the risk is reduced.

questions.question: The use of digital signatures:

options.A: requires the use of a one-time password generator.
options.C: validates the source of a message.

justifications.A: A one-time password generator is not a requirement fbr using digital signatures.
justifications.B:
A digital signature provides integrity and proof of origin for a message but does not address
confidentiality.
justifications.C: The use of a digital signature verifies the identity of the sender.
justifications.D:
A digital signature does not ensure message confidentiality.
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition 481
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The FIRST step in a successful attack to a system is:

justifications.A:
Successful attacks start by gathering information about the target system. This is done in advance
so that the attacker gets to know the target systems and the potential vulnerabilities that can be
exploited in the attack.
justifications.B:
When attackers discover potential vulnerabilities through information gathering, they attempt to gain
access.
justifications.C: An attacker usually launches a denial of service as one of the last steps in the attack.
justifications.D:
When attackers have gained access and possibly infected the victim with a rootkit, they delete audit logs
and take other steps to hide their tracks.

questions.question:
Which of the following methods BEST mitigates the risk of disclosing confidential information through the
use of social networking sites?

options.B: Requiring a signed acceptable use policy
options.C: Monitoring the use of social media

justifications.A:
Providing security awareness training is the best method to mitigate the risk of disclosing
confidential information on social networking sites. It is important to remember that users may
access these services through other means, such as mobile phones and home computers; therefore,
awareness training is most critical.
justifications.B:
Requiring a signed acceptable use policy can be a good control. However, if users are not aware of the
risk, then this policy may not be effective.
justifications.C:
Monitoring the use of social media through the use of a proxy server that tracks the websites that users
visit is not an effective control, because users may access these services through other means, such as
mobile phones and home computers.
justifications.D:
Blocking the use of social media through network controls is not an effective control, because users may
access these services through other means, such as mobile phones and home computers.
482 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor finds that conference rooms have active network ports. Which of the
following prevents this from being of any concern for the enterprise?

options.A: The enterprise network is using an intrusion prevention system (IPS).
options.B: The conference rooms part of the network is isolated from the enterprise network.
options.C: A single sign-on (SSO) has been implemented in the enterprise network.
options.D: Antivirus software is in place to protect the enterprise network.

justifications.A:
An intrusion prevention system (IPS) may stop an attack, but it is far better to restrict the ability of
machines in the conference rooms from being able to access the enterprise network altogether.
justifications.B:
If the conference rooms have access to the enterprise network, unauthorized users may be able to
connect to the enterprise network; therefore, both networks should be isolated either via a firewall
or by being physically separated.
justifications.C:
A single sign-on (SSO) solution is used fbr access control but does not mitigate the risk of unauthorized
people having physical access to the enterprise network.
justifications.D:
Antivirus software reduces the impact of possible viruses; however, unauthorized users would still be able
to access the enterprise network, which is the biggest risk.

questions.question: When conducting a penetration test of an IT system, an enterprise should be MOST concerned with:

options.B: finding all weaknesses in the system.
options.C: restoring systems to the original state.
options.D: logging changes made to production systems.

justifications.A: A penetration test report is a sensitive document because it lists the vulnerabilities of the target system.
justifications.B: Finding all possible weaknesses is not possible in complex information systems.
justifications.C:
After the test is completed, the systems must be restored to their original state. In performing the
test, changes may have been made to firewall rules, user IDs may have been created, or false files
may have been uploaded. These must all be cleaned up before the test is completed.
justifications.D:
All changes made should be recorded, but the most important concern is to ensure that the changes are
reversed at the end of the test.
483
C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing a new web-based order entry system the week before it
goes live. The IS auditor identified that the application, as designed, may be missing several critical controls
regarding how the system stores customer credit card information. The IS auditor should FIRST:

options.A: determine whether system developers have proper training on adequate security measures.
options.B: determine whether system administrators have disabled security controls fbr any reason.
options.C: verify that security requirements have been properly specified in the project plan.
options.D: validate whether security controls are based on requirements which are no longer valid.

justifications.A:
Although it is important for programmers to understand security, it is more important that the security
requirements were properly stated in the project plan.
justifications.B:
System administrators may have made changes to the controls, but it is assumed that the auditor is
reviewing the system as designed a week prior to implementation, so the administrators have not yet
configured the system.
justifications.C:
If there are significant security issues identified by an information systems (IS) auditor, the first
question is whether the security requirements were correct in the project plan. Depending on
whether the requirements were included in the plan affects the recommendations the auditor would
make.
justifications.D:
It is possible that security requirements will change over time based on new threats or vulnerabilities,
but if critical controls are missing, this points toward a faulty design that was based on incomplete
requirements.

questions.question:
When protecting an enterprise's IT systems, which of the following is normally the next line of defense after
the network firewall has been compromised?

justifications.A: Personal firewalls are later in the defensive strategy, being located on the endpoints.
justifications.B:
Antivirus programs are installed on endpoints and on the network, but the next layer of defense after a
firewall is an intrusion detection system (IDS)/intrusion prevention system (IPS).
justifications.C:
An IDS is the next line of defense after the firewall. It detects anomalies in the network/server
activity and tries to detect the perpetrator
justifications.D:
Virtual local area network (VLAN) configurations are not intended to compensate fbr a compromise of
the firewall. They are an architectural good practice.
484 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the BEST control to mitigate the risk of pharming attacks to an Internet banking
application?

options.C: Use of intrusion detection/intrusion prevention systems
options.D: Domain name system (DNS) server security hardening

justifications.A:
User registration and password policies cannot mitigate pharming attacks because they do not prevent
manipulation of domain name system (DNS) records.
justifications.B:
User security awareness cannot mitigate pharming attacks because it does not prevent manipulation of
DNS records.
justifications.C:
The use of intrusion detection/intrusion prevention systems cannot mitigate pharming attacks because
they do not prevent manipulation of DNS records.
justifications.D:
The pharming attack redirects the traffic to an unauthorized website by exploiting vulnerabilities
of the DNS server. To avoid this kind of attack, it is necessary to eliminate any known vulnerability
that can allow DNS poisoning. Older versions of DNS software are vulnerable to this kind of attack
and should be patched.

questions.question:
Which of the following MOST effectively enhances the security of a challenge-response based authentication
system?

options.A: Selecting a more robust algorithm to generate challenge strings
options.B: Implementing measures to prevent session hijacking attacks
options.C: Increasing the frequency of associated password changes
options.D: Increasing the length of authentication strings

justifications.A:
Selecting a more robust algorithm enhances the security; however, this may not be as important in terms
of risk mitigation when compared to man-in-the-middle attacks.
justifications.B:
Challenge-response-based authentication is prone to session hijacking or man-in-the-middle
attacks. Security management should be aware of this and engage in risk assessment and control
design such as periodic authentication when they employ this technology.
justifications.C:
Frequently changing passwords is a good security practice; however, the exposures lurking in
communication pathways may pose a greater risk.
justifications.D:
Increasing the length of authentication strings will not prevent man-in-the-middle or session hijacking
attacks.
485
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which testing environment is required to ensure complete code coverage to test every code path in software
testing, including those that will only be used when an error occurs?

justifications.A: For testing the full code, a white box test is required.
justifications.B:
Without full visibility of the code, error conditions or other code can be missed; a gray box test is an
inappropriate solution.
justifications.C:
Without full visibility of the code, error conditions or other code can be missed; a black box test is an
inappropriate solution.
justifications.D:
Using dynamic testing that runs against live code can result in missed conditions due to sections of code
not being exposed to typical usage.

questions.question:
Which of the following controls should an information systems (IS) auditor consider when reviewing the
integrity of the wireless communications to ensure that the received communications have not been altered in
transit?

options.A: Device authentication and data origin authentication
options.B: Wireless intrusion detection and intrusion prevention systems

justifications.A:
Device authentication and data origin authentication allow wireless endpoints to authenticate each other to
prevent man-in-the-middle attacks and masquerading.
justifications.B:
Wireless intrusion detection and intrusion prevention systems can detect misconfigured devices and rogue
devices and detect, and possibly stop, certain types of attacks.
justifications.C:
Calculating cryptographic hashes for wireless communications allows the receiving device to verify
that the received communications have not been altered in transit. This prevents masquerading and
message modiHcation attacks.
justifications.D:
Packet headers and trailers alone do not ensure that the content has not been altered, because an attacker
can alter the data and the trailer.
486 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing a software-based firewall configuration. Which of the
following represents the GREATEST vulnerability?

options.A: An implicit deny rule as the last rule in the rule base
options.B: Installation on an operating system configured with default settings
options.C: Rules permitting or denying access to systems or networks
options.D: Configuration as a virtual private network (VPN) endpoint

justifications.A: Configuring a firewall with an implicit deny rule is common practice.
justifications.B:
Default settings of most equipment—including operating systems—are often published and provide
an intruder with predictable configuration information, which allows easier system compromise.
To mitigate this risk, firewall software should be installed on a system using a hardened operating
system that has limited functionality, providing only the services necessary to support the firewall
software.
justifications.C: A firewall configuration should have rules allowing or denying access according to policy.
justifications.D:
A firewall is often set up as the endpoint for a virtual private network (VPN).
487
C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The GREATEST risk from an improperly implemented intrusion prevention system (IPS) is:

options.A: too many alerts fbr system administrators to verify.
options.B: decreased network performance due to additional traffic.
options.C: blocking of critical systems or services due to false triggers.
options.D: reliance on specialized expertise within the IT organization.

justifications.A:
A number of false positives may cause excessive administrator workload, but this is a relatively minor
risk.
justifications.B: The intrusion prevention system will not generate any traffic that would impact network performance.
justifications.C:
An intrusion prevention system (IPS) prevents a connection or service based on how it is
programmed to react to specific incidents. If the IPS is triggered based on incorrectly defined
or nonstandard behavior, it may block the service or connection of a critical internal system.
justifications.D:
Configuring an IPS can take months of learning what is and what is not acceptable behavior, but this does
not require specialized expertise.

questions.question:
When reviewing a digital certificate verification process, which of the following findings represents the
MOST significant risk?

options.A: There is no registration authority fbr reporting key compromises.
options.B: The certificate revocation list is not current.
options.C: Digital certificates contain a public key that is used to encrypt messages and verify digital signatures.
options.D: Subscribers report key compromises to the certificate authority.

justifications.A:
The certificate (certification) authority (CA) can assume the responsibility if there is no registration
authority.
justifications.B:
If the certificate revocation list is not current, there can be a digital certificate that is not revoked
that can be used fbr unauthorized or fraudulent activities.
justifications.C:
Digital certificates contain a public key that is used to encrypt messages and verify digital signatures;
therefore, this is not a risk.
justifications.D:
Subscribers reporting key compromises to the CA is not a risk because reporting this to the CA enables
the CA to take appropriate action.
488 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: When using a digital signature, the message digest is computed by the:

justifications.A: The message digest must be computed by the sender and the receiver to ensure message integrity.
justifications.B: The receiver will compute a digest of the received message to verify the integrity of the received message.
justifications.C:
A digital signature is an electronic identiflcation of a person or entity. It is created using asymmetric
encryption. To verify integrity of data, the sender uses a cryptographic hashing algorithm against
the entire message to create a message digest to be sent along with the message. Upon receipt of the
message, the receiver will recompute the hash using the same algorithm.
justifications.D:
The certificate (certification) authority (CA) issues certificates that link the public key with its owner. The
CA does not compute digests of the messages to be communicated between the sender and receiver.

questions.question: Which of the following effectively verifies the originator of a transaction?

options.A: Using a secret password between the originator and the receiver
options.B: Encrypting the transaction with the receiver's public key
options.C: Using a portable document format to encapsulate transaction content
options.D: Digitally signing the transaction with the source's private key

justifications.A:
Because they are a shared secret between the user and the system itself passwords are considered a
weaker means of authentication.
justifications.B:
Encrypting the transaction with the recipienfs public key provides confidentiality for the information but
does not verify the source.
justifications.C: Using a portable document format protects the integrity of the content but not necessarily authorship.
justifications.D:
A digital signature is an electronic identification of a person, created using a public key algorithm,
to verify the identity of the source of a transaction and the integrity of its content to a recipient

questions.question:
An enterprise has established a guest network for visitor access. Which of the following should be of
GREATEST concern to an information systems (IS) auditor?

options.A: A login screen is not displayed fbr guest users.
options.B: The guest network is not segregated from the production network.
options.C: Guest users who are logged in are not isolated from each other.
options.D: A single-factor authentication technique is used to grant access.

justifications.A:
Using a web captive portal, which displays a login screen in the user's web browser, is a good practice to
authenticate guests. However, if the guest network is not segregated from the production network, users
can introduce malware and potentially gain inappropriate access to systems and information.
justifications.B:
The implication of this is that guests have access to the enterprise network. Allowing untrusted
users to connect to the enterprise network can introduce malware and potentially allow these
individuals inappropriate access to systems and information.
justifications.C:
There are certain platforms in which it is allowable for guests to interact with one another. Also, guests
can be warned to use only secured systems, and a policy covering interaction among guests can be
created.
justifications.D:
Although a multifactor authentication (MFA) technique is preferred, a single-factor authentication method
should be adequate if properly implemented.

questions.question: Which of the following provides the GREATEST assurance fbr database password encryption?

justifications.A: Hashing functions are often used to protect passwords, but hashing is not encryption.
justifications.B:
The use of advanced encryption standard (AES) is a secure encryption algorithm that is
appropriate fbr encrypting passwords.
justifications.C: Secure Shell (SSH) may encrypt passwords that are being transmitted but does not encrypt data at rest.
justifications.D:
Triple DES (3DES) is a valid encryption method; however, AES is a stronger and more recent encryption
algorithm.
490 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: The reason a certification and accreditation process is performed on critical systems is to ensure that:

options.A: security compliance has been technically evaluated.
options.B: data have been encrypted and are ready to be stored.
options.C: the systems have been tested to run on different platforms.
options.D: the systems have followed the phases of a waterfall model.

justifications.A:
Certified and accredited systems are systems that have had their security compliance technically
evaluated for running in a specific environment and configuration.
justifications.B:
Certification tests security functionality, including encryption where that is required, but that is not the
primary objective of the certification and accreditation (C&A) process.
justifications.C: Certified systems are evaluated to run in a specific environment.
justifications.D:
A waterfall model is a software development methodology and not a reason fbr performing a C&A
process.

questions.question:
A perpetrator looking to gain access to, and gather information about, encrypted data being transmitted over a
network would MOST likely use:

justifications.A:
In eavesdropping, which is a passive attack, the intruder gathers the information flowing through the
network with the intent of acquiring message contents fbr personal analysis or fbr third parties. Encrypted
traffic is generally protected against eavesdropping
justifications.B:
Spoofing is an active attack. In spoofing, a user receives an email that appears to have originated from
one source when it actually was sent from another source.
justifications.C:
In traffic analysis, which is a passive attack, an intruder determines the nature of the traffic flow
between defined hosts and, through an analysis of session length, frequency and message length,
the intruder is able to guess the type of communication taking place. This typically is used when
messages are encrypted, and eavesdropping would not yield any meaningful results.
justifications.D:
In masquerading, the intruder presents an identity other than the original identity. This is an active attack.
491

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is MOST critical for commercial enterprises that are exchanging data through system
interfaces?

justifications.A:
Data integrity is the overall accuracy, completeness and consistency of data, which is part of data
authentication.
justifications.B:
Data confidentiality is the protection of data from unauthorized access but does not have the highest
priority. The goal of integrity is the most important in information security, especially fbr commercial
enterprises and their financial transactions, which is part of data authentication.
justifications.C:
Data authentication is the process of confirming the origin and integrity of data. It is critical that
enterprises can rely on the origin and integrity of data exchanged through system interfaces.
justifications.D:
Data availability is a measure of how often enterprise data are available to be used by authorized parties
and does not have the highest priority.

questions.question:
An enterprise uses a biometric control system fbr managing access. Which of the following indicates the
MOST effective biometric control system?

options.C: A false-rejection rate (FRR) equal to the false-acceptance rate (FAR)
options.D: A FRR equal to the failure-to-enroll rate (FER)

justifications.A: The biometric that has the highest equal error rate (EER) is the most ineffective.
justifications.B:
The EER of a biometric system denotes the percent at which the false-acceptance rate (FAR) is
equal to the false-rejection rate (FRR). The biometric that has the lowest EER is the most effective.
justifications.C: For any biometric, there is a measure at which the FRR will be equal to the FAR. This is the EER.
justifications.D:
Failure-to-enroll rate (FER) is an aggregate measure of FRR.
492 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13由 Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following is a form of two-factor user authentication?

options.A: A smart card and personal identification number
options.B: A unique User ID and complex, nondictionary password
options.C: An iris scan and a fingerprint scan
options.D: A magnetic-strip card and a proximity badge

justifications.A:
A smart card is something that a user has, while a personal identification number paired with the
card is something the user knows. This is an example of two-factor authentication.
justifications.B:
Both an ID and a password are something the user knows, so this pairing provides single-factor user
authentication regardless of complexity.
justifications.C:
Both an iris scan and a fingerprint scan are something the user is, so this pairing is not a basis fbr
two-factor user authentication.
justifications.D:
Both a magnetic card and a proximity badge are examples of something a user has, so these are not
adequate fbr two-factor authentication.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the physical security measures of an enterprise. Regarding
the access card system, the IS auditor should be MOST concerned that:

options.A:
nonpersonalized access cards are given to the cleaning staff, who use a sign-in sheet but show no proof of
identity.
options.B: access cards are not labeled with the enterprise's name and address to facilitate easy return of a lost card.
options.C:
card issuance and rights administration for the cards are done by different departments, causing
unnecessary lead time fbr new cards.
options.D: the computer system used for programming the cards can only be replaced after three weeks in the event of

justifications.A:
Physical security is meant to control who is entering a secured area, so identification of all
individuals is of utmost importance. It is not adequate to trust unknown external people by allowing
them to write down their alleged name without proof (e.g., identity card or driver's license).
justifications.B:
Having the name and address of the enterprise on the card may be a concern because a malicious finder
can use a lost or stolen card to enter the enterprise premises.
justifications.C:
Separating card issuance from technical rights management is a method to ensure the proper separation of
duties so that no single person can produce a functioning card for a restricted area within the enterprise
premises. The long lead time is an inconvenience but not a serious audit risk.
justifications.D:
System failure of the card programming device would normally not mean that the readers do not function
anymore. It means that no new cards can be issued, so this option is minor compared to the threat of
improper identification.
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition 493
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
When reviewing the procedures fbr the disposal of computers, which of the following should be the
GREATEST concern fbr the information systems (IS) auditor?

options.A:
Hard disks are overwritten several times at the sector level but are not reformatted before leaving the
enterprise.
options.B:
All files and folders on hard disks are separately deleted, and the hard disks are formatted before leaving
the enterprise.
options.C:
Hard disks are rendered unreadable by hole-punching through the platters at specific positions before
leaving the enterprise.
options.D: The transport of hard disks is escorted by internal security staff to a nearby metal recycling enterprise,

justifications.A:
Overwriting a hard disk at the sector level completely erases data, directories, indices and master file
tables. Reformatting is not necessary, because all contents are destroyed. Overwriting several times makes
useless some forensic measures, which are able to reconstruct former contents of newly overwritten
sectors by analyzing special magnetic features of the platter's surface.
justifications.B:
Deleting and formatting only marks the sectors that contained files as being free. Publicly available
tools are sufficient for someone to reconstruct data from hard drives prepared this way.
justifications.C:
Although hole-punching does not delete file contents, the hard disk cannot be used anymore, especially
when head parking zones and track zero information are impacted. Reconstructing data would be
extremely expensive because all analysis must be performed under a clean room atmosphere and is
only possible within a short time frame or until the surface is corroded.
justifications.D:
Data reconstruction from shredded hard disks is impossible, especially when the scrap is mixed with other
metal parts. If the transport can be secured and the destruction can be proved as described in the option,
this is a valid method of disposal.

questions.question:
A new business application requires deviation from the standard configuration of the operating system (OS).
What activity should the information systems (IS) auditor recommend to the security manager as a FIRST
response?

options.A: Initial rejection of the request because it is against the security policy
options.B: Approval of the exception to policy to meet business needs
options.C: Assessment of the risk and identification of compensating controls
options.D: Revision of the OS baseline configuration

justifications.A:
The security policy may be waived with management approval to meet business requirements; it is not up
to the security manager to refuse the deviation.
justifications.B:
The security manager may make a case for deviation from the policy, but this should be based on a
risk assessment and compensating controls. The deviation itself should be approved in accordance with a
defined exception handling process.
justifications.C:
Before approving any exception, the security manager should first check fbr compensating controls
and assess the possible risk due to deviation.
justifications.D:
Updating or revising the baseline configuration is not associated with requests fbr deviations.
494 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An enterprise has created a policy that defines the types of websites that users are forbidden to access. What is
the MOST effective technology to enforce this policy?

justifications.A:
A stateful inspection firewall is of little help in filtering web traffic because it does not review the content
of the website, nor does it take into consideration the site's classification.
justifications.B:
A web content filter accepts or denies web communications according to the configured rules. To
help the administrator properly configure the tool, enterprises and vendors have made available
uniform resource locator blacklists and classifications for millions of websites.
justifications.C:
A web cache server is designed to improve the speed of retrieving the most common or recently visited
web pages.
justifications.D:
A proxy server is incorrect because a proxy server services the request of its clients by forwarding
requests to other servers. Many people incorrectly use proxy server as a synonym of web proxy server
even though not all web proxy servers have content filtering capabilities.

questions.question: The cryptographic hash sum of a message is recalculated by the receiver. This is to ensure:

options.D: the integrity of data transmitted by the sender.

justifications.A: A hash function ensures integrity of a message; encrypting with a secret key provides confidentiality.
justifications.B: Signing the message with the private key of the sender ensures nonrepudiation and authenticity.
justifications.C: Authenticity of the message is provided by the digital signature.
justifications.D:
If the hash sum is different from what is expected, it implies that the message has been altered. This
is an integrity test.

questions.question:
The computer security incident response team of an enterprise disseminates detailed descriptions of recent
threats. An information systems (IS) auditor's GREATEST concern should be that the users may:

options.A: use this information to launch attacks.

justifications.A:
The enterprise's computer security incident response team (CSIRT) should disseminate recent
threats, security guidelines and security updates to the users to assist them in understanding the
security risk of errors and omissions. However, this introduces the risk that the users may use this
information to launch attacks, directly or indirectly. An information systems (IS) auditor should
ensure that the CSIRT is actively involved with users to assist them in mitigation of risk arising
from security failures and to prevent additional security incidents resulting from the same threat
justifications.B: Forwarding the security alert is not harmful to the enterprise.
justifications.C: Implementing individual solutions is unlikely and inefficient, but not a serious risk.
justifications.D:
Users failing to understand the threat is not a serious concern.
496 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following is an indicator of the effectiveness of a computer security incident response team?

options.B: Number of security vulnerabilities that were patched
options.C: Percentage of business applications that are being protected

justifications.A:
The most important indicator is the financial impact per security incident. It may not be possible
to prevent incidents entirely, but the team should be able to limit the cost of incidents through a
combination of effective prevention, detection and response.
justifications.B:
Patching of security vulnerabilities is important but not a direct responsibility of the computer security
incident response team (CSIRT).
justifications.C: The CSIRT is not responsible for the protection of systems. That is the responsibility of the security team.
justifications.D:
The number of penetration tests measures the effectiveness of the security team and the patch
management process, but not the effectiveness of the CSIRT.

questions.question: Which of the following would MOST likely be used to establish the objectives and coverage of an audit?

justifications.A:
Although prior audit reports can give an idea of risk or deficiencies at a certain point in the past, they may
not accurately represent the current state of the risk.
justifications.B:
Understanding the business strategy can help the auditor to identify the type of risk that may impact the
business but cannot be used to establish the audit objective.
justifications.C:
Audit objectives and coverage should always be based on the risk. A risk-based approach for
audit planning assists the auditor in determining the extent and nature of the type of testing. Risk
assessment reports will best give the auditor a sense of the risk an enterprise faces.
justifications.D:
Audit deliverables are the output of the audit and not something to be used in the initial planning.
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition 497
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
The IT team of an enterprise informs the information systems (IS) auditor of a concern that some users might
be loading illegal software packages onto a network. Which of the following should the IS auditor recommend
fbr identifying if the concern is valid?

options.D: Policies that result in instant dismissal if violated

justifications.A:
Diskless workstations act as a preventive control and are not totally effective in preventing users from
accessing illegal software over the network.
justifications.B:
The periodic checking of hard drives would be the most effective method of identifying illegal
software packages loaded onto the network.
justifications.C: Antivirus software will not necessarily identify illegal software unless the software contains a virus.
justifications.D:
Policies are a preventive control to lay out the rules about loading the software but will not detect the
actual occurrence.

questions.question:
An online stock trading firm is in the process of implementing a system to provide secure email exchange
with its customers. What is the BEST option to ensure confidentiality, integrity and nonrepudiation?

justifications.A:
Symmetric key encryption uses a single pass phrase to encrypt and decrypt the message. Although this
type of encryption is strong, it suffers from the inherent problem of needing to share the pass phrase in a
secure manner and does not address integrity and nonrepudiation.
justifications.B: Digital signatures provide message integrity and nonrepudiation; however, confidentiality is not provided.
justifications.C:
Message digest algorithms are a way to design hashing functions to verify the integrity of the message/
data. Message digest algorithms do not provide confidentiality or nonrepudiation.
justifications.D:
A digital certificate contains the public key and identifying information about the owner of the
public key. The associated private key pair is kept secret with the owner These certificates are
generally verified by a trusted authority, with the purpose of associating a person's identity with
the public key. Email confidentiality and integrity are obtained by following the public key-private
key encryption. With the digital certificate verified by the trusted third party, nonrepudiation of the
sender is obtained.
498 C/SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing the authentication controls of an enterprise should be MOST
concerned if:

options.A: user accounts are not locked out after five failed attempts.
options.B: passwords can be reused by employees within a defined time frame.
options.C: system administrators use shared login credentials.

justifications.A:
If user accounts are not locked after multiple failed attempts, a brute force attack can be used to gain
access to the system. Although this is a risk, a typical user has limited system access compared to an
administrator.
justifications.B:
The reuse of passwords is a risk. However, the use of shared login credentials by administrators is a more
severe risk.
justifications.C:
The use of shared login credentials makes accountability impossible. This is especially a risk with
privileged accounts.
justifications.D:
If password expiration is not automated, it is most likely that employees will not change their passwords
regularly. However, this is not as serious as passwords being shared, and the use of shared login
credentials by administrators is a more severe risk.

questions.question:
The information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the implementation of a storage area network (SAN).
The SAN administrator indicates that logging and monitoring is active, hard zoning is used to isolate data
belonging to different business units and all unused SAN ports are disabled. The administrator implemented
the system, performed and documented security testing during implementation and is the only user with
administrative rights to the system. What should the IS auditor's initial determination be?

options.A: There is no significant potential risk.
options.B: Soft zoning presents a potential risk.
options.C: Disabling unused ports presents a potential risk.
options.D: The SAN administrator presents a potential risk.

justifications.A:
Although the storage area network (SAN) may have been implemented with good controls, there is risk
created by the combination of roles held by the SAN administrator.
justifications.B: Hard zoning is more secure than soft zoning.
justifications.C: Unused ports should generally be disabled to increase security.
justifications.D:
The potential risk in this scenario is posed by the SAN administrator One concern is having a
single point of failure. Because only one administrator has the knowledge and access required to
administer the system, the enterprise is susceptible to risk. For example, if the SAN administrator
decided to quit unexpectedly or was otherwise unavailable, the enterprise may not be able to
adequately administer the SAN. In addition, having a single administrator for a large, complex
system, such as a SAN, also presents a separation of duties risk. The enterprise currently relies
entirely on the SAN administrator to implement, maintain and validate all security controls; this
means that the SAN administrator can modify or remove those controls without detection.
499
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following exposures associated with the spooling of sensitive reports fbr offline printing should
an information systems (IS) auditor consider to be the MOST serious?

options.A: Sensitive data might be read by operators.
options.B: Data might be amended without authorization.
options.C: Unauthorized report copies might be printed.
options.D: Output might be lost in the event of system failure.

justifications.A:
Operators often have high-level access as a necessity to perform their job duties. To the extent that this is
a risk, it exists fbr any form of nonlocal printing and is not specifically tied to spooled reports.
justifications.B: Data on spool files are no easier to amend without authority than any other file.
justifications.C:
Spooling fbr offline printing may enable additional copies to be printed unless adequate safeguards
exist as compensating controls.
justifications.D: Loss of data at the spooler level only requires reprinting.

questions.question: Web and email filtering tools are valuable to an enterprise PRIMARILY because they:

options.A: protect the enterprise from viruses and nonbusiness materials.
options.D: assist the enterprise in preventing legal issues.

justifications.A:
The main reason fbr investing in web and email filtering tools is that they significantly reduce risk
related to viruses, spam, mail chains, recreational surfing and recreational email.
justifications.B:
Maximizing employee performance can be true in some circumstances (i.e., it needs to be implemented
along with an awareness program so that employee performance can be significantly improved).
However, the primary benefit is protecting the enterprise from viruses and nonbusiness activity.
justifications.C: Safeguarding the enterprise's image is a secondary benefit.
justifications.D:
Preventing legal issues is important, but not the primary reason fbr filtering.
500 C!SA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following types of firewalls provide the GREATEST degree and granularity of control?

justifications.A:
Screening routers and packet filters work at the protocol, service and/or port level. This means that they
analyze packets from layers 3 and 4 and not from higher levels.
justifications.B: A packet filter works at too low a level of the communication stack to provide granular control.
justifications.C:
The application gateway is similar to a circuit gateway, but it has specific proxies for each service.
To handle web services, it has a hypertext transmission protocol (HTTP) proxy that acts as an
intermediary between externals and internals but is specifically for HTTP. This means that it not
only checks the packet internet protocol (IP) addresses (open systems interconnection (OSI) Layer
3) and the ports it is directed to (in this case port 80, or layer 4), but also checks every HTTP
command (OSI Layers 5 and 7). Therefore, it works in a more detailed (granularity) way than the
other choices.
justifications.D:
A circuit gateway is based on a proxy or program that acts as an intermediary between external and
internal accesses. This means that, during an external access, instead of opening a single connection to
the internal server, two connections are establishedone from the external server to the proxy (which
conforms the circuit-gateway) and one from the proxy to the internal server. OSI Layers 3 and 4 (IP
and Transmission Control Protocol) and some general features from higher protocols are used to perform
these tasks.

questions.question:
After installing a network, an enterprise implemented a vulnerability assessment tool to identify possible
weaknesses. Which type of reporting poses the MOST serious risk associated with such tools?

justifications.A: The differential reporting function provided by this tool compares scan results over a period of time.
justifications.B:
False-positive reporting is one in which the system falsely reports a vulnerability. Controls may be in
place, but are evaluated as weak, which should prompt a rechecking of the controls.
justifications.C:
False-negative reporting on weaknesses means the control weaknesses in the network are not
identified and, therefore, may not be addressed, leaving the network vulnerable to attack.
justifications.D:
Less-detail reporting requires additional tools or analysis to determine the existence and severity of
vulnerabilities.
501

©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question:
Which of the following is the MOST reliably effective method fbr dealing with the spread of a network worm
that exploits vulnerability in a protocol?

options.A: Install the latest vendor security patches immediately.
options.B: Block the protocol traffic in the perimeter firewall.
options.C: Block the protocol traffic between internal network segments.
options.D: Stop the services that the protocol uses.

justifications.A:
Installing the latest patches will improve the situation only if a patch has been released that addresses
the particular vulnerability in the protocol. Also, patches should not be installed prior to testing, because
patching systems can create new vulnerabilities or impact performance.
justifications.B:
Blocking the protocol on the perimeter does not stop the worm from spreading if it is introduced via
portable media.
justifications.C:
Blocking the protocol helps to slow the spread, but also prohibits any software that uses it from working
between segments.
justifications.D:
Stopping the services is the most effective way to prevent a worm from spreading, because it
directly addresses the means of propagation at the lowest practical level.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing an enterprise's controls related to email encryption.
The enterprise's policy states that all sent email must be encrypted to protect the confidentiality of the
message because the enterprise shares nonpublic information through email. In a public-key infrastructure
implementation properly configured to provide confidentiality, email is encrypted with:

options.A: the sender's private key and decrypted with the sender's public key.
options.B: the recipienfs private key and decrypted with the sender's private key.
options.C: the sender's private key and decrypted with the recipienfs private key.
options.D: the recipienfs public key and decrypted with the recipienfs private key.

justifications.A:
Encrypting a message with the sender's private key and decrypting it with the sender's public key ensures
that the message came from the sender; however, it does not guarantee message confidentiality. With
public key infrastructure, a message encrypted with a private key must be decrypted with the responding
public key, and vice versa.
justifications.B: The sender does not have access to the receiver's private key.
justifications.C: A message encrypted with the sender5s private key cannot be decrypted using the recipienfs private key.
justifications.D:
Encrypting a message with the recipienfs public key and decrypting it with the recipienfs private
key ensures message confidentiality, because only the intended recipient has the correct private key
to decrypt the message.
502 CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following types of firewalls would BEST protect a network from an Internet attack?

justifications.A:
A screened subnet firewall would provide the best protection. The screening router can be a
commercial router or a node with routing capabilities and the ability to allow or avoid traffic
between nets or nodes based on addresses, ports, protocols, interfaces, etc. The subnet would isolate
Internet-based traffic from the rest of the enterprise network.
justifications.B:
Application-level gateways are mediators between two entities that want to communicate, also known as
proxy gateways. The application level (proxy) works at the application level, not just at a packet level.
This is the best solution to protect an application but not a network.
justifications.C:
A packet filtering router examines the header of every packet or data traveling between the Internet and
the enterprise network. This is a low-level control.
justifications.D:
A circuit level gateway, such as a Socket Secure server, will protect users by acting as a proxy but is not
the best defense for a network.

questions.question: Neural networks are effective in detecting fraud because they can:

options.A: discover new trends because they are inherently linear.
options.B: solve problems where large and general sets of training data are not obtainable.
options.C: address problems that require consideration of a large number of input variables.
options.D: make assumptions about the shape of any curve relating variables to the output.

justifications.A: Neural networks are inherently nonlinear.
justifications.B:
Neural networks do not work well at solving problems fbr which sufficiently large and general sets of
training data are not obtainable.
justifications.C:
Neural networks can be used to attack problems that require consideration of numerous input
variables. They are capable of capturing relationships and patterns often missed by other statistical
methods, but they do not discover new trends.
justifications.D:
Neural networks make no assumption about the shape of any curve relating variables to the output.
CISA ® Official Questions, Answers & Explanations Manual 13th Edition 503
©ISACA. All Rights Reserved.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST encrypts data on mobile devices?

justifications.A:
Elliptical curve cryptography (ECC) requires limited bandwidth resources and is suitable for
encrypting mobile devices.
justifications.B:
Data encryption standard uses less processing power when compared with advanced encryption standard

An enterprise provides information to its supply chain partners and customers through an extranet
infrastructure. Which of the following should be the GREATEST concern to an information systems (IS)

A secure sockets layer (SSL) has been implemented fbr user authentication and remote administration of

options.C: Inbound traffic is blocked unless the traffic type and connections have been specifically permitted.
options.D: The firewall is placed on top of the commercial operating system (OS) with all default installation options.

justifications.B: It is appropriate to maintain the firewall policies as needed.

platform itself In most circumstances, when commercial firewalls are breached, that breach is

system further increases the risk of vulnerabilities and exploits.

questions.question:
An enterprise is proposing to establish a wireless local area network (WLAN). Management asks the
information systems (IS) auditor to recommend security controls fbr the WLAN. Which of the following
is the MOST appropriate recommendation?

options.A: Physically secure wireless access points to prevent tampering.
options.B: Use service set identifiers that clearly identify the enterprise.
options.C: Encrypt traffic using the wired equivalent privacy (WEP) mechanism.
options.D: Implement the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) to allow active monitoring.

justifications.A:
Physically securing access points, such as wireless routers, and preventing theft address the risk of
malicious parties tampering with device settings. If access points can be physically reached, it is
often a simple matter to restore weak default passwords and encryption keys, or to totally remove
authentication and encryption from the network.
justifications.B:
Service set identifiers should not be used to identify the enterprise, because hackers can associate the
wireless local area network (WLAN) with a known enterprise, and this increases their motivation to
attack and, potentially, the information available to do so.
justifications.C:
The original wired equivalent privacy (WEP) security mechanism has been demonstrated to have a
number of exploitable weaknesses. The more recently developed Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) and
WPA 2 standards represent considerably more secure means of authentication and encryption.
justifications.D:
Installing Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) on wireless access points can open up security
vulnerabilities. If SNMP is required at all, then SNMP v3, which has stronger authentication mechanisms
than earlier versions, should be deployed.

questions.question:
Which of the following controls will MOST effectively detect the presence of bursts of errors in network
transmissions?

justifications.A:
Parity check (known as vertical redundancy check) also involves adding a bit (known as the parity bit)
to each character during transmission. In this case, where there is a presence of bursts of errors (i.e.,
impulsing noise during high transmission rates), it has a reliability of approximately 50 percent. At higher
transmission rates, this limitation is significant.
justifications.B:
Echo checks detect line errors by retransmitting data to the sending device fbr comparison with the
original transmission.
justifications.C: A block sum check is a form of parity checking and has a low level of reliability.
justifications.D:
The cyclic redundancy check (CRC) can check fbr a block of transmitted data. The workstations
generate the CRC and transmit it with the data. The receiving workstation computes a CRC and
compares it to the transmitted CRC. If both of them are equal, then the block is assumed error free.
In this case (such as, in parity error or echo check), multiple errors can be detected. In general,
CRC can detect all single-bit and double-bit errors.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing the network infrastructure of a call center and determines
that the internal telephone system is based on Vbice-over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technology. Which of the
following is the GREATEST concern?

options.A: Voice communication uses the same equipment that is used fbr data communication.
options.B: Ethernet switches are not protected by uninterrupted power supply units.
options.C: Voice communication is not encrypted on the local network.
options.D: The team that supports the data network also is responsible for the telephone system.

justifications.A:
Vbice-over Internet Protocol (VoIP) telephone systems use the local area network (LAN) infrastructure of
an enterprise fbr communication, which can save on wiring cost and simplify the installation and support
of the telephone system. This use of shared infrastructure is a benefit of VoIP and therefore is not a
concern.
justifications.B:
VoIP telephone systems use the LAN infrastructure of an enterprise for communication, typically
using Ethernet connectivity to connect individual phones to the system. Most enterprises have a
backup power supply for the main servers and systems, but typically do not have uninterrupted
power supply units for the LAN switches. In the case of even a brief power outage, not having
backup power on all network devices makes it impossible to send or receive phone calls, which is a
concern, particularly in a call center.
justifications.C:
VblP devices do not normally encrypt the voice traffic on the local network, so this is not a concern.
Typically, a VblP phone system connects to a telephone enterprise voice circuit, which is not normally
encrypted. If the system uses the Internet fbr connectivity, then encryption is required.
justifications.D:
VblP telephone systems use the LAN infrastructure of an enterprise fbr communication, so the personnel
who support and maintain that infrastructure are now responsible fbr the data and voice network by
default. Therefore, this is not a concern.

questions.question:
An enterprise is planning to deploy an outsourced cloud-based application that is used to track job applicant
data fbr the human resources department. Which of the following should be the GREATEST concern to an
infonnation systems (IS) auditor?

options.A: The service level agreement (SLA) ensures strict limits fbr uptime and performance.
options.B: The cloud provider will not agree to an unlimited right-to-audit as part of the SLA.
options.C: The SLA is not explicit regarding the disaster recovery plan capabilities of the cloud provider.
options.D: The cloud provider's physical data centers are in multiple cities and countries.

justifications.A:
Although this application may have strict requirements for availability, it is assumed that the service level
agreement (SLA) would contain these same elements; therefore, this is not a concern.
justifications.B:
The right-to-audit clause is good to have, but there are limits on how a cloud service provider may
interpret this requirement. The task of reviewing and assessing all the controls in place at a multinational
cloud provider would likely be a costly and time-consuming exercise; therefore, such a requirement may
be of limited value.
justifications.C:
Because the SLA normally specifies uptime requirements, the means used to achieve those goals (which
include the specific disaster recovery plan capabilities of the provider) are typically not reviewed in-depth
by the customer, nor are they typically specified in an SLA.
justifications.D:
Having data in multiple countries is the greatest concern because HR applicant data can contain
personally identifiable information. There may be legal compliance issues if these data are stored
in a country with different laws regarding data privacy. Although the enterprise is bound by the
privacy laws where it is based, it may not have legal recourse if a data breach happens in a
jurisdiction where the same laws do not apply.

questions.question:
A review of wide area network (WAN) usage discovers that traffic on one communication line between
sites, synchronously linking the master and standby database, peaks at 96 percent of the line capacity. An
information systems (IS) auditor should conclude that:

options.A: analysis is required to determine if a pattern emerges that results in a service loss fbr a short period of time.
options.B: WAN capacity is adequate for the maximum traffic demands because saturation has not been reached.
options.C:
the line should immediately be replaced by one with a larger capacity to provide approximately 85 percent
saturation.
options.D: users should be instructed to reduce their traffic demands or distribute them across all service hours to

justifications.A:
The peak at 96 percent can be the result of a one-off incident (e.g., a user downloading a large
amount of data); therefore, analysis to establish whether this is a regular pattern and what causes
this behavior should be carried out before expenditure on a larger line capacity is recommended.
justifications.B:
A peak traffic load of 96 percent is approaching a critical level, and the auditor should not assume that
capacity is adequate at this time or for the foreseeable future. Further investigation is required.
justifications.C:
If the peak is established to be a regular occurrence without any other opportunities fbr mitigation
(usage of bandwidth reservation protocol or other types of prioritizing network traffic), the line should be
replaced because there is the risk of loss of service as the traffic approaches 100 percent. At this point,
further research is required.
justifications.D:
If the peak traffic load is a rare one-off occurrence or if traffic can be reengineered to transfer at other
time frames, then user education may be an option. Further investigation will be required.

questions.question: Which of the following will BEST maintain the integrity of a firewall log?

options.A: Granting access to log information only to administrators
options.B: Capturing log events in the operating system (OS) layer
options.C: Writing dual logs onto separate storage media
options.D: Sending log information to a dedicated third-party log server

To enforce segregation/separation of duties (SoD), administrators should not have access to log files. This
primarily contributes to the assurance of confidentiality rather than integrity.
justifications.B:

systems (OSs) layer, etc. However, there is no log integrity advantage in capturing events in the OS layer.
justifications.C:
If it is a highly mission-critical information system, it may be nice to run the system with a dual log mode.
Having logs in two different storage devices will primarily contribute to the assurance of the availability
of log information, rather than maintaining its integrity.
justifications.D:
Establishing a dedicated third-party log server and logging events in it is the best procedure for
maintaining the integrity of a firewall log. When access control to the log server is adequately
maintained, the risk of unauthorized log modification is mitigated, therefore improving the
integrity of log information.

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor reviewing a cloud computing environment that is managed by a third

The service level agreement (SLA) does not address the responsibility of the vendor in the case of a

questions.question:
An information systems (IS) auditor is performing a review of a network. Users report that the network
is slow and web pages periodically time out. The IS auditor confirms the users' feedback and reports the
findings to the network manager. The most appropriate action fbr the network management team should be to

use a protocol analyzer to perform network analysis and review error logs of local area network (LAN)
equipment.
options.B: take steps to increase the bandwidth of the connection to the Internet.
