questions.question:
In a small enterprise, an employee performs computer operations and, when the situation demands, the
program modifications. Considering the lack of separation of duties in the IT environment, which of the

justifications.B:

preferred, this practice is not always possible in small enterprises.
justifications.C:

should recommend a formal change control process that manages and can detect changes to
production source and object code, such as code comparisons, so the changes can be reviewed
on a regular basis by a third party. This is a compensating control process.
justifications.D:

questions.question:
Which is the MOST important step an auditor should consider while developing an audit plan based on a
risk-based approach?

options.A: Inventory the information systems in use in the enterprise and categorize them.
options.B: Assess what risk affect systems and the severity of the impact on the business.
options.C: Determine which systems impact critical enterprise functions and how close to real time they operate.
options.D: Rank the systems based on risk assessment and decide the audit priority, resources, schedule and

justifications.B:

area to error, which can be material, assuming there are no related internal controls), control risk (the risk
a material weakness will not be prevented or detected by internal controls) and detection risk (the risk
substantive tests will not detect an error which can be material).
justifications.C:
While planning the audit, the auditor decides what level of audit risk they are willing to accept
The more effective and extensive the audit work is, the less risk of a weakness going undetected.
Understanding the critical systems of an enterprise and how close to real time they operate will help
ensure that the auditor has the information needed to make a risk decision.
justifications.D:
Not all systems require a place in the audit plan; some noncritical systems may rank higher than critical
systems. Critical systems impacting the business should get priority in the audit plan when a risk-based
approach is taken.

questions.question: The implementation of which of the following would MOST effectively prevent unauthorized access to a system administration account on a web server?

options.A: Host intrusion detection software installed on the server

justifications.A: Host intrusion detection software assists in the detection of unauthorized system access but does not prevent such access.
justifications.B: Although controls regarding password expiration and lockout from failed login attempts are important, two-factor authentication methods or techniques most effectively reduce the risk of stolen or compromised credentials. Password-only-based authentication may not provide adequate security.
justifications.C: Although controls regarding password complexity are important, two-factor authentication methods or techniques most effectively reduce the risk of stolen or compromised credentials.
justifications.D: Two-factor authentication requires a user to use a password in combination with another identification factor that is not easily stolen or guessed by an attacker. Types of two-factor authentication include electronic access tokens that show one-time passwords on their display panels and biometric authentication systems.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor is reviewing an organization to ensure that evidence related to a data breach case is preserved. Which of the following choices would be of MOST concern to the IS auditor?

options.A: End users are not aware of incident reporting procedures.
options.B: Log servers are not on a separate network.
options.D: There is no chain of custody policy.

justifications.A: End users should be made aware of incident reporting procedures, but this is not likely to affect data integrity related to the breach. The information systems (IS) auditor would be more concerned that the organization's policy exists and provides for proper evidence handling.
justifications.B: Having log servers segregated on a separate network might be a good idea because ensuring the integrity of log server data is important. However, it is more critical to ensure that the chain of custody policy is in place.
justifications.C: Although not having valid backups is a concern, the more important concern is a lack of a chain of custody policy. Data breach evidence is not normally retrieved from backups.
justifications.D: Organizations should have a policy in place that directs employees to follow certain procedures when collecting evidence that may be used in a court of law. Chain of custody involves documentation of how digital evidence is acquired, processed, handled, stored and protected, and who handled the evidence and why. If there is no policy in place, it is unlikely that employees will ensure that the chain of custody is maintained during any data breach investigation.

questions.question: With the help of a security officer, granting access to data is the responsibility of:

justifications.A: Data owners are responsible for the access to and use of data. Written authorization for users to gain access to computerized information should be provided by the data owners. Security administration with the owners' approval sets up access rules stipulating which users or group of users are authorized to access data or files and the level of authorized access (e.g., read or update).
justifications.B: Programmers develop the access control software that regulates the ways that users can access the data (update, read, delete, etc.), but the programmers do not have responsibility for determining who gets access to data.
justifications.C: Systems analysts work with the owners and programmers to design access controls according to the rules set by the owners.
justifications.D: The librarians enforce the access control procedures they have been given but do not determine who gets access.

questions.question: Which of the following presents an inherent risk with no distinct identifiable preventive controls?

justifications.A: Piggybacking is the act of following an authorized person through a secured door and can be prevented using deadman doors. Logical piggybacking is an attempt to gain access through someone who has the rights (e.g., electronically attaching to an authorized telecommunication link to possibly intercept transmissions). This can be prevented by encrypting the message.
justifications.B: Viruses are malicious program code inserted into another executable code that can self-replicate and spread from computer to computer via sharing of computer disks, transfer of logic over telecommunication lines or direct contact with an infected machine. Antivirus software can be used to protect the computer against viruses.
justifications.C: Data diddling involves changing data before they are entered into the computer. It is one of the most common abuses because it requires limited technical knowledge and occurs before computer security can protect the data. There are only compensating controls for data diddling.
justifications.D: The shutdown of an application can be initiated through terminals or microcomputers connected directly (online) or indirectly (dial-up line) to the computer. Only individuals knowing the high-level logon ID and password can initiate the shutdown process, which is effective if there are proper access controls.

questions.question: An information systems (IS) auditor performing a telecommunication access control review should be concerned PRIMARILY with the:

options.A: maintenance of access logs of usage of various system resources.
options.B: authorization and authentication of the user prior to granting access to system resources.
options.C: adequate protection of stored data on servers by encryption or other means.
options.D: accountability system and the ability to identify any terminal accessing system resources.

justifications.A: The maintenance of access logs of usage of system resources is a detective control. A preventive control should be used first.
justifications.B: The authorization and authentication of users before granting them access to system resources (networks, servers, applications, etc.) is the most significant aspect in a telecommunication access control review because it is a preventive control. Weak controls at this level can affect all other aspects of security.
justifications.C: The adequate protection of data being stored on servers by encryption or other means is a method of protecting stored information and is not a network access issue.
justifications.D: The accountability system and the ability to identify any terminal accessing system resources deal with controlling access through the identification of a terminal or device attempting to connect to the network. This is called node authentication and is not as good as authenticating the user sitting at that node.

questions.question: The PRIMARY purpose of installing data leak prevention software is to:

options.A: restrict user access to confidential files stored on servers.
options.B: detect attempts to destroy sensitive data in an internal network.
options.C: block external systems from accessing internal resources.
options.D: control confidential documents leaving the internal network.

justifications.A: Access privileges to confidential files stored on the server is controlled through digital rights management (DRM) software.
justifications.B: Potential attacks to systems on the internal network would normally be controlled through an intrusion detection system (IDS) and an intrusion prevention system (IPS), and by security controls of the systems themselves. Data leak prevention (DLP) systems focus on data leaving the enterprise.
justifications.C: Controlling what external systems can access internal resources is the function of a firewall rather than a data loss prevention (DLP) system.
justifications.D: A server running a DLP software application uses predefined criteria to check whether any confidential documents or data are leaving the internal network.

questions.question: The development, implementation and integration of capability and maturity modeling quality tools, techniques and processes will MAINLY facilitate and foster the quality of:

justifications.A: When IT governance improves, all its constituent building blocks improve also, including strategies, policies and procedures.
justifications.B: Effective and improved IT governance directs management and its processes, procedures, etc. to help the business achieve its goals.
justifications.C: Quality management strategies and policies embedded into IT governance outline how the IT strategies, policies, processes, procedures and standards are maintained, used and improved over time as the enterprise changes.
justifications.D: When IT governance gets fostered, enterprise IT standards and frameworks are maintained and improved over time.

questions.question: Which of the following potentially blocks hacking attempts?

justifications.A: An intrusion detection system (IDS) is a detective control.
justifications.B: A honeypot solution captures intruder activity or traps the intruders when they attempt to explore a simulated target.
justifications.C: An intrusion prevention system (IPS) is deployed as an inline device on a network or host that can detect and block hacking attempts.
justifications.D: A network security scanner identifies vulnerabilities but does not remediate them.

questions.question: An enterprise is planning to replace its wired networks with wireless networks. Which of the following would BEST secure the wireless network from unauthorized access?

options.B: Permit access to only authorized media access control addresses.
options.C: Disable open broadcast of service set identifiers.

justifications.A: Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) can be cracked within minutes. WEP uses a static key that has to be communicated to all authorized users, thus, management is difficult. Also, there is a greater vulnerability if the static key is not changed at regular intervals.
justifications.B: The practice of allowing access based on media access control is not a solution, because media access control (MAC) addresses can be spoofed by attackers to gain access to the network.
justifications.C: Disabling open broadcast of service set identifiers is not an effective access control, because many tools can detect a wireless access point that is not broadcasting.
justifications.D: Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) 2 implements most of the requirements of the IEEE 802.11i standard. The advanced encryption standard (AES) used in WPA2 provides better security. Also, WPA2 supports the Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) and the pre-shared secret key authentication model.

questions.question: Which of the following specifically addresses how to deal with unauthorized activity on the enterprise's IT systems and how to recover from an attack?

justifications.A: The incident response plan (IRP) determines the information security responses to incidents such as cyberattacks on systems and/or networks. This plan establishes procedures to enable security personnel to identify, mitigate and recover from malicious computer incidents, such as unauthorized access to a system or data, denial-of-service or unauthorized changes to system hardware or software.
justifications.B: The IT contingency plan addresses IT system disruptions and establishes procedures for recovering from a major application or general support system failure. The contingency plan deals with ways to recover from an unexpected failure, but it does not address the identification or prevention of cyberattacks.
justifications.C: The business continuity plan (BCP) addresses business processes and provides procedures for sustaining essential business operations while recovering from a significant disruption. Although a cyberattack can be severe enough to require use of the BCP, the IRP would be used to determine which actions should be taken both to stop the attack and to resume normal operations after the attack.
justifications.D: The continuity of operations plan addresses the subset of enterprise missions that are deemed most critical and contains procedures to sustain these functions at an alternate site for a short time period.

questions.question:
An IT auditor reviewed the transactions log of an audit engagement partner and discovered some suspicious
activity, which may be interpreted as potential fraud. However, the auditor was not able to determine the
circumstances around the incidents or obtain further evidence. The auditor decided to disclose this information
in case there are questions in the audit quality assurance review. In taking this action, the auditor has:

options.A:
violated auditing standards because the auditor should inform the appropriate authorities/management of
the suspected fraud.
options.B: violated laws because unlawful activities should have been reported to the appropriate regulatory agency.
options.C: not violated auditing standards because the auditor has committed to disclose the facts, when required.
options.D: not violated auditing standards because there is a lack of evidence as to whether a fraud has been

justifications.A:
In situations where auditors are not able to obtain sufficient or appropriate audit evidence
necessary to achieve the audit objectives, they should disclose the situation to audit management
and, if necessary, to those charged with audit governance, as per established procedures.
Restrictions or limitations on the scope of the audit and achievement of the audit objectives should
also be disclosed in the communication of the audit results. The auditor should also inform the
appropriate authorities in the enterprise if the indicators of the fraud are sufficient to recommend
an investigation. Thus, the auditor has a duty to act even though the available facts do not prove
that an irregularity has occurred. Auditors should disclose all material facts and findings known to
them that, if not disclosed, may distort the reporting of activities under review.
justifications.C: The auditor has a duty to report the results of audit work in the audit communication.
justifications.D:
Limitations on the achievement of audit objectives should be disclosed in the audit results and reporting,
and a possible irregularity should be disclosed to the appropriate enterprise authorities.
